column1: subject2status

TOP 1000 REVIEWER on 14 Jun. 2012 // This is a great little set of dice and plastic counters. The set I received included yellow counters. The plastic tube is quite robust and the whole thing is no bigger than a tube of smarties. Each of the three dice have 1 side with an L, 1 with a C, 1 with an R and 3 with a single dot.The game is very simple. You start with three counters for each player and throw the three dice in turn. The letters are the direction in which you must pass a 'coin', to the person on your left or right and C going to the 'bank' in the centre. But where you throw a dot, you get to keep that number of coins.When your next turn arrives, if you have three or more coins then you throw all three dice, if you have two coins then you only throw two dice, or indeed one if you have only one coin left. The game continues until only one person is left with any coins and they then win all the banked coins.Jackpot!Instructions are included but if you've read this far, you already know exactly how to play!We were introduced to this game whilst visiting family on holiday in Ireland and we played with three 5  cent coins each. My 5 and 7 year olds were facinated by it and wanted to keep playing. The great thing is the game doesn't last too long - with 6 people, about 10 minutes per game. We played three games before the kids bedtime and it was just enough for us all.The gameplay is engaging and crucially you get to communicate and have a good laugh together. It's a great way of enjoying the company of others.It's a really inexpensive game and slips into your pocket or hand luggage if you're travelling. A good all-round buy and highly recommended!
column2: simple concept prooves good fun for all ages // 5.0 // 14 Feb. 2011 // By

column1: Ms. K. A. Young

on 14 Feb. 2011 // This is so simple yet it has the excitement of ""GAMBLING""! We play it starting with 10 pennies each. We don't put out the player with no pennies, we let them wait in, not throwing the dice, but they'll get a penny passed from left or right eventually - and might win in the end! Age range in our game = 5/6 years to 84. Age 5 learnt left from right. I recommend it to get a group like this to laugh together.
column2: No idea why this is reviewed so highly! // 1.0 // 5 Feb. 2016 // By

column1: Ali

on 5 Feb. 2016 // Bought as a stocking filler for my 4 and 7 year old and am very disappointed!The game is cheap enough and I bought it on the back of reading such positive reviews.I'm not sure if its that my kids enjoy games ranging from pairs and top trumps to rumikub, qwixx, sequence and yatzee but this game is beyond boring! There is no skill involved and my kids  were uninterested after the first game we played.Only positive I found was that it encourages kids to learn left and right.Not sure what I'm missing!
J. Birch

on 20 Jun. 2014 // This game is so simple but brilliant to play for all ages.... it definitely creates fun and entertainment and for the price is a bargain. I have played it with many friends and family and they have all brought one for themselves. Its very small to carry around so a great game to take on holiday or when you are out and about to entertain the kids. Arrived quickly, recommend seller.
Adam

on 7 April 2014 // A simple concept of a game that all can play from  five and upwards. The game can be played with the supplied counters, but more fun is had by playing for 5 or 10p coins; further, it's a great way of introducing children into the delights of playing for money with all of the highs and lows of winning  money.It's small, compact and a great travel game.
Brownbill

on 25 Dec. 2015 // This is a simple game - trying to explain it would not do it justice. It sounds dull - rolling the dice and moving the counters either left, right or centre - but weirdly, in a group of adults and kids, it really is enjoyable. I play it with the grandparents and my 4 and 6 year olds and we all have fun. It's innocent, old fashioned, anti-television entertainment!
Mrs J

on 27 Feb. 2013 // This is such a simple game and good for children to teach them right and left. However, I also bought this as a game for adults to play at Christmas. We play with 1p coins instead of the tokens! You need quite a few people to make it more fun but it can wipe you out of your pennies quite quickly if play a few rounds! Good fun though.
Happy Shopper

on 23 July 2011 // This is really good fun to play!  Our version of the game is normally played with at least four adults and the counters are replaced by 10p or 20p pieces, so there's a pot of money to be won each round of the game.  It's a very simple game of luck, where no skill is required.  I think it's over-priced, but would still recommend it.",""

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Rory-Story-Cubes-Fright-Dice/dp/B014UIQWSQ","Product Description This Original set is a perfect first pack of Rory's Story Cubes pocket sized story generator. Simply roll the 9 dice and begin your story, 'Once upon a time....' and use the embossed images to spark your imagination. With just four lines of instructions and no time or story length limits and no right or wrong answers, anyone can become a great storyteller.Rory's story Cubes are a fantastic, fun way to inspire creative thinking, encourage social confidence, develop language, improve vocabulary and promote problem solving skills for ages six and above.Presented in a little magnetic box Rory's Story Cubes are perfect for travel, waiting in a restaurant in the classroom, as an icebreaker, for idea generation, or to make learning a new language more fun - the uses are endless.The nine dice, each with a unique image on all sides holds a total of 54 images - This means that with every roll, there are over a million combinations to use for storytelling inspiration.Rory's Story Cubes Originals have received Dr. Toy's '10 Best Games' Award, the 'Major Fun Award' and 'People's Choice Award' amongst others. column1: InYourShoes

on 5 Oct. 2010 // A nice little gadget for all sorts of occasions. It's use can be varied, from simply telling a story to creating a group story or even acting it out. It's a fun toy for kids and a handy tool for anyone working with kids , such as Drama teachers. I've used it for both simply having some fun with it and working with individuals and groups and am loving it. It's a set of unlimited possibilities, games and stories that fit into a pocket. Easy.
A. Martin

on 5 Nov. 2010 // We've had great fun with these Cubes. We got a set for our 6 year old to distract him on a long journey. The images are cleverly designed so that they can be interpreted in different ways. He was captivated by them and he still gets them out when he friends come round. It's so sweet to hear them tell stories together. Good too for adults over a glass or two - although the stories tend to be a bit different! Highly recommended.
column2: Simple idea, very portable, great for developing creative thinking // 4.0 // 18 Jan. 2012 // By

column1: Pam

on 18 Jan. 2012 // We bought this for our 6 year old son. He understood the concept very quickly and enjoys playing. There are 9 dice, in a nice box, so very easy to take anywhere. Limited by child's vocabulary and experiences - but good for encouraging creative thinking and discussion.
column2: Stimulates imagination, many hours of enjoyment, compact, lightweight, durable, lovely presentation box, highly recommend! // 5.0 // 31 Jan. 2016 // By

column1: Clairy Fairy 17

TOP 1000 REVIEWER on 31 Jan. 2016 // Overview: These are a set of cubes which show a different image on each face. The aim of these are for the children to roll them and put them in order to make a sequence ready for a story. The child is then to use their imagination to create a story based on those characters, props and themes.The images include: house, tower, water fountain, balloon, lightening bolt, rainbow, torch, aeroplane, earth, bridges, bee, dice, turtle, eye, clock, key, masks, hands, padlock, balancing beam, compass, moon, speech bubble, stick, tent, fish, lightbulb, sheep etc.Uses: These are a fantastic resource to use in the classroom or at home. They come in a variety of styles which will suit different topics and children's interests. In the classroom they can be used individually with children or they could be used as a whole group with each child having a different image to add to the whole class story . At home, or in the car journey they can be used to keep children amused and stimulated throughout.They are:> Compact, lightweight and durable.> Come in a lovely presentation box to keep them safe!> Have a different image on each face e.g a character, prop or themes/ideas.> Have a variety of themes to choose from e.g. other imagination ones and a new batman one has just been released.Would highly recommend to anyone who has children or works with them! They are fab!!!! Many hours of enjoymentActivity ideas:> Could be used to help develop EAL learners language recall. This may include rolling a dice and the children in the small EAL group need to say the key word as quick as possible. The first child to say it wins a point.Read more ›
column2: Gets the imagination working, old and young!! // 5.0 // 9 Jan. 2012 // By

column1: Bamboo

on 9 Jan. 2012 // 9 cubes, each with an individual picture of all sides, creating a unique story on each throw.We bought this as ""not sure what to buy"" for a niece and nephew  for xmas, not thinkng for one minute how much fun it would be! Our daughter of 10 was so envious of it we then ordered her one too. We took ours on holiday over the xmas period. Out of all the electronic gizmo's our daughter took with her this game kept her amused the most, which was very refreshing when we live in a world of technology! It really made her use her imagination. We all took it in turns to create the next adventure of the story. She would write out the next chapter to the stories too. We had so much fun listening to the adventures!It is absolutley brilliant, really gets you thinking and rather addictive. And completely broadened our 10 years vocabulary and imagintion. Its small enough to pop into handbag too which meant we could use it the plane, car journey, restaurants etc etc.I totally recommend this product for all ages. Really good fun. The Creativity Hub Rory's Story Cubes
highlandlass
on 21 Feb. 2011 // excellent product which really stimulates the imagination. I use it for creative writing classes with children as part of my work.  Really sparks  ideas and is a great fun item.
column2: The best toy by far // 5.0 // 12 Jan. 2011 // By

on 12 Jan. 2011 // Rory's story cubes were purchased on a recommendation from the Guardian newspaper, and how right they were! Such a simple idea that anybody can play. My daughter hasn't put them down since getting them and she even carries them in her handbag- ideal when out for a meal with Grandparents! I have been recommending them to everybody!

column1: Hogi

on 8 Nov. 2010 // What a great toy!  I bought the cubes for my 4 & 5 year old and we have all had a great time playing with the cubes and making up stories.  The idea is so simple - roll the cubes & whatever comes up, you make a story to match.  My children like acting out the stories they make up too so this adds to the fun.  It makes a really good family game for everyone to take turns making up stories and makes a change from board games.  I also found them good inspiration when thinking up new bedtime stories.  Will be treasured for years to come.",""

column1: Amazon Customer

on 7 Dec. 2015 // Very pleased with the Dice; they are well made, feature great colouring, are easy on the eyes and roll well However, if you are wanting the plastic box with the dice , you will want to read this next bit:Originally, I thought they all came with the boxes  and checked the reviews for each to check. At least one customer on each product said they had received a plastic box so I went ahead with the purchase.When I ordered 5 sets of 7-dice  they all came in the plastic boxes.When I ordered 2 sets of 7-dice , they instead arrived in plastic re-sealable bags. The bags themselves are fine but I prefer the boxes for better storage.I got in touch with the seller  who explained a number of details to me:When inquiring about the minimum number of 7-die sets to order to get the boxes -'The number at which we send them with boxes depends a little bit on which of our packers processes the order, but normally it's five. Alternatively, if you select expedited  delivery, we send them with the boxes, because we normally use Interlink Express and they don't have the height restrictions Royal Mail applies to large letters.'The seller also said in another correspondence - 'The boxes are more intended as a gift container, and generally don't have a long life expectancy in actual day to day usage.' So don't throw them at the wall to see if they bounce!So, order a minimum 5 sets OR choose express delivery to get the plastic box.If any issues/questions, get in touch with the seller - had extremely good customer service!",""

on 30 Dec. 2011 // This present, although for a Granddaughter, captured everyone's imagination. It is excellent for keeping children amused for hours and can only be a help in increasing their word power and how to make up stories.
column2: Stimulate your imagination and get your kids involved. // 5.0 // 26 Feb. 2015 // By

column1: otter

on 26 Feb. 2015 // I love them. They were bought for me as a present and I have renewed my writing ability and imagination at the age of 50. You get 9 cubes and the idea is to write a story using the pictures as they fall. I often only use 3 dice and write a really short 300-500 word story or a bit of prose. Extend your imagination by taking 1 dice and when the picture comes up do not take it at face value. Write down all the things the picture COULD represent, not just the obvious, e.g. the lightning cube could be lightning, speach bubble, ghost, fir tree etc etc. Let your mind wander.
column2: Years of stories and fun. // 5.0 // 22 Jun. 2012 // By

on 22 Jun. 2012 // The cubes were bought for my first Grandaughter at the age of one,even though not old enough to hold them we still make up stories.Bought as a handbag emergency kit they are perfect for entertaining any age,all you need to add is a little imagination.Used them on a plane,ferry and in the car also good at picnics for adults and children alike.These are just fab.

column2: Good idea let down by quality // 2.0 // 20 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: Jan

on 20 Dec. 2010 // I bought this as a present for a 3 year old. It is a good concept and he could play it with his sisters of 5 and 7 without too much fighting. The idea is that you collect beads by throwing a coloured dice  and stack them in the correct order on posts. However several of the beads would not fit on the posts until we did some judicious sanding- while the 3 year old waited impatiently clutching a red bead- and although the instructions said to ""store the beads in the box lid so everyone could reach"" the packaging does not include a lid but is similar to a cereal box. The beads come in a small plastic bag and roll off of the table at frequent intervals. What should have been a fun game from the start was let down by the quality of the materials and packaging. It will be a fun game now because we have fixed it but thats what the manufacturer is supposed to do!
grandma

column2: It's really rather good // 4.0 // 10 Nov. 2015 // By

column1: JB

TOP 100 REVIEWER on 10 Nov. 2015 // I got a free sample of this to review.The packaging it comes in is nice, though I did notice that everything in the box could easily have fit into something less than half the size. I am not a big fan of boxes too big for the contents, but at least the box looks nice, something moving about inside it will make it more exciting before unwrapping it as a gift, and so it's not all bad.Inside are the three different colours of sand and some moulds to play with, moulds that could of course just as easily be used with regular sand or other things.The play sand doesn't really feel like sand, but like a cross between saw dust and plasticine, not an entirely unpleasant feeling, really, and they are easy to work with, crumbling like sand sometimes, and sticking together like plasticine when you compress them properly.Using one of the moulds, the shape held rather well, though it did collapse a little bit on one of the ridges on the side. Still, an impressive result, I think, for something like this.After using it, there was a little bit of sand dust that I'd not managed to get back in the bag, but whatever causes the sand to stick together doesn't feel as if it leaves any residue on neither hands or work surface. Another good result, I think.Had I still been a child, I would have thought this was great fun - well, I still think it's great fun, to be honest. It is something that has a lot of potential for creativity while avoiding being too messy.
Sophie

TOP 1000 REVIEWER on 10 Dec. 2015 // My daughters  have really enjoyed playing with this kinetic sand. The sand flows easily but when compressed it will retain its shape whether through using the three supplied moulds or their hands. They have even decided to use their collection of play doh moulds and cutters to great effect.I have found it is best to use the sand on a large tray because it does tend to get dropped on the floor / carpet. The bigger lumps are easy to pick up and the smaller pieces can often be collected by tapping them with bigger pieces, but it's almost inevitable that the vacuum cleaner will need an outing at the end of play.  That in itself is not a problem but it does mean that each time the sand is used a small amount is wasted.The sand supplied with this kit is in bags that have to be cut open so we have transferred the sand to zip lock bags and that works well. However, much like the afore mentioned play doh eventually it all gets mixed together and ends up as a lovely brown, so at the minute we have four bags of sand.In terms of use I find that ensuring the girls have clean dry hands is the best way to stop and sand sticking to their skin. I have also found it useful to have a soft paint brush to clean the play doh moulds to recover all of the sand.So there we are: it's better in many ways than play doh because it's easier to clean up and it doesn't set rock hard if left exposed to the air. I have to say I was surprised just how much my daughters like playing with this sand and it holds an edge very well so it is possible to produce some very lovely creations that only children can.Please note this sand was sent to me for review purposes.
column2: Mess free fun for children // 5.0 // 6 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: niki

HALL OF FAMETOP 50 REVIEWER on 6 Dec. 2015 // Disclaimer: I received this product for a discount in exchange for an unbiased review.The packaging is quite large and colourful - but I would say slightly generous with its claims for the product inside. The box is a bit bigger than it needs to be to hold three light packs of play sand, three  moulds and a container which for me was actually an almost broken plastic tray which got pushed aside and replaced straight away.The coloured play sand itself is a fun gift for any young child - with three reasonably sized packs of yellow, green and pink sand enough to keep kids entertained for a while. The different coloured sands inevitably mix together but that's to be expected and surprisingly, any mess on the floor or surfaces are easy to clean off. The sand is easy to mould and manipulate as it is soft and sticky, but not to the level that it's too sticky to use - hours of fun! The shapes once they come out of the three moulds last well and are worthwhile - though they're only likely to be used once and then forgotten about. Overall, the set, though a little on the small side, is creative and fun and makes a pretty nice present.",""

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Orchard-Toys-92911-Magic-Cauldron/dp/B0002CYTVM","Product Description A fantastic educational game from the multi-award winning Chimp and Zee range of games and puzzles. Find the different coloured Ostriches hiding in the sand! The game board folds out to make a 3D board with slits so that the Ostriches can bury their heads in the ""sand"". Each of their heads is glittery and has a different colour. The object is to spin the spinner and, depending on where the arrow points either pick one or two Ostriches or put one back. You need to collect 4 of the 6 colours so can you remember which coloured Ostrich is where? The first player to successfully collect the four colours they need is the winner.Head in the Sands game is great fun for children and easy for parents to explain. The game can help your child learn through play. Easy to set up you can start playing in just a few minutes and everyone has a chance to win. Only takes ten minutes to play and is great fun even when it's not your turn.The game is presented in a quality cardboard carton complete with carry-handle and glitter printing. This game is for 2 - 4 players and suitable for ages 3 - 5 years. column1: niki

HALL OF FAMETOP 50 REVIEWER on 17 Dec. 2015 // This is a really fun play set for kids. Mine loves playing in the sandpit during the summer but now she can do pretty much the same thing indoors during the colder months.My little one has lots of Play-Doh sets and loves this kind of creative toys. This sand is a bit different from Play-Doh and it does not dry out. I would say it is not a replacement for Play-Doh but rather a different game altogether.This sand has a kind of spongy consistency and sticks together quite well. Using the included moulds the shapes are coming out nicely even with the small details being visible. It is sticky but after a while it breaks apart again, it is actually fun to watch. Looks almost like it is moving on its own - have a look on my video.It is completely odourless and does not stick to hands and most importantly to carpets. This makes it very easy to clean after your kiddo makes a mess. You can just vacuum it up from carpets and on solid floors it can be easily swept up.The amount of sand you get in this set  is a good starting point. You can easily do a couple of moulds from it in one go. However, if you want to build something like a decent size sand castle you will need a few more packs.In the box you get a plastic container for storing the sand. It is only made out of thin plastic and it will easily break so would recommend getting something sturdier. Sand comes in a sealed plastic bag stored away in the container. You also get three moulds, princes cardboard cutouts and some jewels.The box itself is very nice with lots of colourful pictures. Perfect for a gift. One thing I did not like is the fact that all the things you get only take half the space inside. The other half is empty so the box could be much smaller.Read more ›
column2: A truly fantadtic play sand set. // 5.0 // 11 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Valerie Bartlett

TOP 100 REVIEWER on 11 Dec. 2015 // • Note: The supplier kindly sent me a review sample for evaluation, the opinions expressed here are entirely my own •Lovely printed full colour box with all the items inside. This is a great gift for children that enjoy playing with play sand. The theme of this set is disney princesses. Included in the box are the following:-3 moulds450 grams of pink play sand 24 jewels4 different cardboard princess cutoutsThis would make any little girl very happy to have such a lovely complete set, it has all 4 princesses . They come as cutout cardboard shapes to play with and decorate and make your own Disney Princess scene.The moulds are firm plastic and are not flexible but should last long as they cannot be easily broken. This set is really suitable for young children and the moulds could be reused again and again and if you should run out of the play sand provided you could always use the moulds with clay, glycerine soap or beach sand. They are small enough to pack in a ziplock bag and take with you to the beach.Really sweet set that I am sure lots of little girls would be happy to receive at Christmas time. Best to play with an adult present due to small jewels. Also, best to store in a different tub to the one provided as it is not that strong and will break in time.
column2: Jewels, princesses and pink magic sand // 5.0 // 16 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Cheryl M-M

TOP 1000 REVIEWER on 16 Dec. 2015 // This is a beautiful Disney Princess play sand set a good 'novelty' product for children who are perhaps more accustomed to more usual toys. It is certainly different and it has a real novelty value that is guaranteed to grab and hold their attention.The box contains a bag of sand, a tray and three moulds. The sand itself is basically sand mixed with a harmless polymer and a bright pink dye. The polymer makes the sand grains stick together slightly so if you pack it into a mould the sand holds the shape of the mould for a while. The adhesion gradually breaks down and the sand shape slowly falls apart into semi-loose grains again. It's a bit like playing with set sand on the beach but the sand is more 'sticky' and the polymer helps give any moulded shape greater definition.The polymer itself is clean and odour-free. The sand has no distinct smell and it doesn't leave any sticky residue on your hands. It doesn't stick to carpets or solid surfaces or anything. If you do get any on the carpet you can just vacuum it up.The sand is coloured bright pink although you can buy lots of other colours separately if you want .Overall this is a great toy sand set and I would highly recommend it.Please note I received this in exchange for a honest review and this has not biased my opinion in any way.",""

column1: ДД²

on 5 Dec. 2015 // ★ PLAYMOBIL★ 5494★ 2015★ AGE GUIDE : 4-10 ★ 101 pc★ Assembly instruction booklet includedI always pop a chunky advent calendar in my basket to have from Amazon, and when the price decreases ; I place the order, which happened in October this year.The colourful, quality box measures around 40 cm x 30 cm x 8 cm overall and comes in a strong outer carton for safe transit.◄ SPOILER ALERT! ►Like a box of crackers, the box has a cardboard overlay detailing the contents, day-by-day, which I have gone on to show in my images to give an idea of the content this year.  I discard this layer when giving as a gift so the recipient doesn't  know what to expect behind each window.  If it is opened carefully, there is no evidence of this.Underneath, on one side of the box is a tree-framed, snowy scene with a path meandering off into the distance with an inbuilt hanger to put on a wall, if required.  If just standing the calendar on a flat surface, which is quite successful due to its depth, the hanger just looks like the moon in the wintry night sky and doesn't spoil the scene.On the other side are the advent calendar windows, showing Santa & his elves, busy with preparations and loading the sleigh, watched over by an angel.  The windows vary in sizes and the numbers are easy to spot, each surrounded by a bright yellow star.  They are relatively easy to open, by depressing and pushing back on the tab, and then tear the perforations.  The rewards occasionally need basic assembling, adding to the fun.The contents are designed to go on the colourful backdrop - the base of which measures around 46 cm maximum x 24.Read more ›

column1: Cookieland

on 29 Dec. 2015 // My sister made me an advent calendar back in 2004 out of matchboxes, papier mache and the Playmobil nativity sets, after all this time it is getting rather battered and loved but my two young children adore it. I was delighted to discover Playmobil made their own calendars a few years ago but at the time the price was out of my range and I didn't think it looked like you got much inside for the price. How wrong was I! On the spur of the moment I ordered this the last week of November, my husband was not impressed when he realized I had spent nearly £25 on an advent calendar/Seasonal toy. However when it arrived one look on the back of the box swayed him. Note: Don't let the recipients of the calendar see the back of the box for it shows you what you receive behind each door! Each door holds something for Santa's workshop, e.g a blue basket with six teeny tiny animal figures , a wheelbarrow and teddy bear, carrots for the reindeer, a ""present"" with toy racing car. There are four little card boxes behind various doors which you need to fold up into presents. This advent calendar comes with four figures - An angel, two elves and Santa himself , all hidden behind a different door. Inside the box there is a beautiful cardboard backdrop, you have to pop out some parts and fold it to make it stand. It really is gorgeous and the children loved setting up the scene each day. The card game you get is just a little box with a simple game of snap  inside. I think my children would have preferred an extra toy for the grotto but it is a nice idea. I will definitely be buying these annually. The excitement on my bairns faces each morning was wonderful and something you would not be able to get from a chocolate calendar. Plus they have a beautiful toy to get out every Christmas.
column2: We all loved it. Bit tricky keeping all the bits together ... // 5.0 // 31 Dec. 2014 // By

column1: MrsM

on 31 Dec. 2014 // First time I have bought one. We all loved it. Bit tricky keeping all the bits together especially with small kids, but I managed it by only really letting them play with it Xmas eve when it was complete . The doors are quite firm so smaller kids need a bit of effort to open them. I had to open the door for my 3 year old to break the perforations then close it for her to open in the morning. As I have all the bits, it may be back again next year and I can mix up all the pieces for them. I will be looking to see what other ones there are too.",""

on 20 Oct. 2012 // Charming and personal, it's a lovely keepsake for a bride and groom to remember their Wedding Day at Christmastime.  It arrived on time with the correct wording.
Yvette
on 4 Dec. 2011 // I wouldnt have said its a toy more of a keepsake.Very pleased with it, will be a lovely present.quick delivery
Paula Martin
on 29 Nov. 2012 // Very unique and well packaged, the bride and groom were delighted with the gift and displayed it at their wedding.
RLTiow

on 11 Dec. 2013 // It is always difficult to know whether something that you buy online will live up to expectations - well this one certainly will. The bauble was delivered well packaged, quickly and looked really good. It is heavier than you might expect, giving the impression of quality.You also get a chance to personalise both sides and include up to 4 lines on the back. My wording was acknowledged quickly by the seller after I sent a message using the 'contact seller' button.All in all, I am really happy with the purchase and I look forward to giving the happy couple a keepsake that will remind them of their special day each passing year.
Mrs Lorraine Boyle

on 7 April 2014 // i bought these baubles as a little something extra to go with wedding presents. Was not dissapointed they were lovely.My friend loved it she said it was their best wedding present. i am giving other one to my neice in August and im sure she will be just as pleased.I like to buy gifts which i think you would not normally get 2 of the same thats the main reason i bought these.Considering these were personalised i recieved these very quick within a week of ordering which was great.Thank you
sarahl20021

on 5 April 2013 // Bought to put in a hamper of wedding gifts, this was the couples favourite gift of all! Especially as they married just before Christmas. This could be bought for any married couple no matter how long they are married as you can personalise the date. As well as the date you can add the name of the couple and a personal message on the other side. Something a couple can keep and use on their tree year after year I highly recommend this. I will definitely buy another when the next wedding comes along.
Leigh Edmondson

on 24 Jan. 2016 // My friend cried when she opened this as it's beautiful.  They got married a few days before Christmas so I wanted something that they could hang on their tree every year.  There's not a lot of space for a message but after a telephone conversation with the seller, we managed to be creative and get my message to fit - she was very helpful.  It feels a good solid bauble and comes well packaged.  Would definitely purchase again
column2: THE best little ""gift"" for a couple you know who are getting wed ! // 5.0 // 14 Jun. 2013 // By

column1: mosses farmhouse

on 14 Jun. 2013 // Such GREAT value ... YOU choose the lettering ... they send it out immediately.I had deliberately mis-spelled one of the words in MY caption, and an extremely charming lady went to the trouble of phoning me to find out if the lettering was indeed correct.  How they manage to throw long-distance phone calls into the cost I have no idea?!BRILLIANT FIND !",""

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Pegasus-Spiele-GmbH-ONUWBEZ-Ultimate/dp/B00HS7GG5G","Any number may play this game, limited only by the amount of space around the table. Each turn a player draws a chip to determine the next target and the robot must reach it.. With the computer down, the players search for the shortest moves to the target, using one or more of the robots. The player who finds the most efficient move receives the chip as a reward. When the chips have all been taken, the player with the most is the winner! This edition is compatible with the blue box edition, but has the original boards and adds a silver robot to add to the fun.   What you get; 4x Two-sided game board quarters, 5x Plexiglas Robots, 1x Plexiglas Center Piece • 1x Sand clock • 21x chips • 1x Disc • 1x Rule Booklet","Technical Details Item Weight676 g Product Dimensions31.5 x 22.9 x 5.1 cm Manufacturer recommended age:10 years and up Item model number122RGG Main LanguageEnglish translation, English Number of Game Players2 to 10 players Assembly RequiredNo Batteries Required?No Batteries Included?No    Additional Information ASINB0002V5EVW Best Sellers Rank 242,127 in Toys & Games  #330 in Toys & Games > Arts & Crafts > Art Sand Shipping Weight680 g Delivery Destinations:Visit the Delivery Destinations Help page to see where this item can be delivered. column1: Chosen One

on 25 May 2009 // The first time i played this game was in school with twenty, 17 year old, class mates. The game has no limit on the number of people wishing to play it - even one person can play alone. The game only requires logic to play it - it has no complicated rules. I would suggest that the game is suitable for anoyone older than 11 years.It is a superb game with many permitations and combinations of the board - so it is impossible to have the same experience with the game twice. It is a truely brilliant game with an educational spin that will develop speed of thought and logical thinking. *****
NK

on 4 April 2013 // Superb game, my family is hooked. It is clever and social at the same time. Delivery was fast and hassle-free. Customer service was accommodating and pleasant when we wanted to change delivery address after putting the order through. Our only complaint is about the piece at the centre, which is supposed to hold the pieces of the board together; its legs are a bit shallow and slip out if playing on a tablecloth on the table. Other than that, very pleased.
Jacob

on 2 July 2015 // Arrived early, which is always a good thing when you're excited for a new item. Instructions in French however there's lots of YouTube videos showing you how to play. A fun game that really makes you think!
SugarRay
on 30 Aug. 2013 // I pretty much hated all board games until i played this!really helps work on your problem solving skills and it good fun too!+fast dispatch/delivery",""

column1: Thomas Douglas

TOP 500 REVIEWERVINE VOICE on 20 Oct. 2010 // For a little more money than a sugarific choccie advent calendar you can have this wonderful Lego calendar with a new mini-build every day through the advent period.And, of course, you still have the Lego after Christmas, rather than a chocolate addiction.The 24 different builds are fun and varied, with a Christmas and gifting theme.  A total of 6 miniature figures are included, two of them Santas, one of which is naked!  There is also Santas shower, which explains why he is naked.Other mini models include a Christmas tree, train set, snowman, helicopter, fire engine and much more.Much fun will be had with the daily models and after you have done your first Lego advent your children will want to do it every year after.Highly recommended.
Wendy Richards

on 19 Nov. 2010 // Not sure of what to get a 6 year old for his birthday and so close to Christmas - I saw this advertised and thought what a brilliant idea - when he is fed up with all his other presents he still has this one to unwrap everyday until Christmas!Arrived gift wrapped the day after the order and wow - little 6 year old was over the moon. A great present and something to enjoy everyday and also something to add to over the next few years - birthdays and Christmas all sorted!!!
Val Harvey

on 24 Dec. 2010 // I bought this advent calendar for my son - he loved it.  Each day has a separate model with a guide to build the model in the flap.  There is a fold down card base for putting the models on, if wanted, and together they make a Christmas scene - parents at the table, children playing with various toys and musical instruments,a dog and a cat, a fire to sit in front of, snowman - including a carrot nose - for the garden and of course a Christmas tree.  My favourite - and sure it was put in to amuse parents - was Santa taking a shower!As with all lego it is quite pricey, but will last for eons and can be integrated with other lego models, or brickes just used for free crafting.I would certainly buy one again.  Much more fun than chocolate!
Jacie

on 6 Dec. 2010 // not cheap as advent calendars go but it's one of the best I've seen and my son actually plays with it after he's built the pieces. Far better than getting a sweet or chocolate every day. My son is 10 and loves all things lego. Most of all he likes to construct his own designs and he likes that you can mix and match each days build. They are proper lego bricks but also have pieces that you wouldn't generally find like skateboards and drum kits. We're only on day 6 but it's a huge hit in this household and I'd thoroughly recommend it for both boys and girls - it's certainly the type of thing I would have loved as a kid
column2: Every lego fan's dream // 5.0 // 1 Jan. 2011 // By

column1: Ms. N. Pattinson

on 1 Jan. 2011 // This is simply a must-have for every lego-obsessed child  Rather healthier than a lump of chocolate, and rather more exciting than your average picture of a robin on a snowy branch, this calendar does it all. Anticipation every morning to see what is in the next window, the chance to build a little set every day, marvel at its cuteness, put it all together at the end to make a fantastic scene, and this is all before Christmas Day! Yes, it's a little on the pricey side for a calendar, but it's a wonderful item that I will be buying for my son for many years to come.
column2: Excellent value for money // 5.0 // 17 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: Mortimer's tie

on 17 Dec. 2010 // It may seem a lot to pay for an advent calendar but there is a small toy in each window which your child can build each day.It's a great incentive to get them out of bed on a cold winter's morning! My son was ill for a couple of days but still managed to open that day's window before going back to bed! All the toys can be built up into a Christmas scene which compliments any other Lego your child already has.I can already see we will be getting one every year from now on.
Pete Ford

on 24 Dec. 2010 // The Advent calendar entranced my two girls , although my wife suspects I bought it for me . There are lots of  cute little toys inside, and lots of special pieces . The only real down side is that the instructions to make each model are limited to a picture on the inside of the day's door, which in most cases was enough, but challenged the younger girl a bit.
column2: How To Get The Kids Out Of Bed // 5.0 // 18 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: AllieKat

on 18 Dec. 2010 // Really pleased with this Lego Advent.My 2 daughters, 5 and 7, have been thrilled with this and so am I as getting them up in the morning has never been so easy.I did buy a lego board so that the characters and pieces they made would not get lostLego City 2824: Advent Calendar and they could build a 'story' with them.I shall certainly buy another one next year.",""

see less","Interesting calendar that isn't generally available in the UK // 4.0 // 8 Dec. 2013 // By
Ms. A. Barker

on 8 Dec. 2013 // I admit it, I'm an adult who is a fan of Playmobil. Despite having no kids, every year my partner and myself buy a Playmobil advent calendar each and we have a lot of fun opening them every day on the run up to Christmas. My partner has the Pirate Treasure Cove calendar this year.This year I decided to get this slightly unusual calendar as I hadn't seen it for sale anywhere else. It's available from Playmobil's German site but not from their UK one . I like dragons and fantasy stuff like that, and this calendar looked completely bonkers with a dragon, two knights in full armour and weaponry, a ballista thing that shoots bolts across the room, some treasure and a magic dwarf shooting lightning from its hands. What's not to like?As it is only Dec 8th I've only opened a few windows so far but we both found that the items that we received in our calendars would allow a child to start playing immediately - day 1 gave us both a figure, the next few days gave us accessories for the figure and we both got a larger item on about day 6 so we didn't feel fobbed-off with getting tiny accessories all the time. I think a lot of thought has gone into the ""timing"" of each item in the calendars.As for quality, everything is up to Playmobil's usual standard. Some items require you to assemble them so children may need a hand with this, though they're more fiddly than complicated. The boxes come with a nicely-printed cardboard diorama so you can display your collection as you open the calendar and receive the items.
Julie Rankin

on 1 Oct. 2015 // Purchased a different Playmobil Advent Calendar last Year, and the children loved it.  It contained loads of different pieces that you can then play with on background scenery that is part of the box. I have no reason to believe that this one is any different. Obviously more expensive than a chocolate advent calendar, but much more, lasting fun!

on 22 Jun. 2015 // This is a very good set including dragon three men and a horse. The detail is excellent. Gets used together and mixed with other playmobil toys. Very good. It is separated as is advent calendar. But we bought for birthday, as had everything we wanted as dragon starter set. Excellent box set.

on 6 Dec. 2015 // When I first received the calendar for my son he loved it, it looked really good and worth the money but after opening door number 5 when he was meant to get head and body armour for the horse he got 2 head armours instead and is very disappointed and says he can't put the figure on the horse now as it falls off easily. Maybe this is just a one off defect but I would be careful now if thinking of purchasing.
column2: The Dragons Treasure Battle was perfect and the children had no complaints about that whatsoever // 5.0 // 5 Jan. 2015 // By

column1: Alljan

on 5 Jan. 2015 // I bought these, , for the children in my class, since we are no longer allowed to feed them chocolate. It was late in arriving, but the children didn't mind too much since they had the excitement of opening lots of doors in the one go. What was not acceptable was that several of the items for Unicorn Fairyland were incomplete. When paying a high price for items one expects a high standard. Very disappointing. The Dragons Treasure Battle was perfect and the children had no complaints about that whatsoever. All concerned were allowed free choice over which calendar they opened, and it was interesting to note that only one girl chose the Dragon calendar. All others were true to type.
Joxy

on 16 Jan. 2016 // Purchased half price, thus making this a well worth buy!  My 8yr old quickly figured out days the larger parts of the set were behind, , but it didn't impact on his enjoyment and excitement of opening a window and finding another playmobil character or item.There's also a playmobil card game included, which kept him, and his friends entertained for hours.I personally, would not spend £20 on an advent calendar, no matter how awesome - and this was awesome, so finding it for half price was fantastic.  Furthermore, this set goes beautifully with the main gift I bought my son, which is one of the playmobil castles, that again, I managed to purchase on offer.  I never quite saw the appeal of playmobil before, seemed like lego's poor cousin, however, after observing my son playing with the stuff, I am a convert.  Its well constructed, sturdy, and offers great imaginative play opportunities, and its reasonably affordable, especially when offers are on.

column1: BWebster

on 26 Jan. 2016 // I bought this for my three nephews aged between 7 and 10. They all thought it was brilliant - I didn't expect it to be such a hit! It's really cool stuff actually as although it acts like sand, it can be moulded into other shapes e.g. they made a hedgehog, a tower and a mouse! It sort of feels like something between sand and putty. One thing I will say is that it needs to be played with on a tray as the sand does still cling to whatever it was on/ whoever touches it. So after playing, my nephews did need to wash their hands.I wouldn't want to try and get it out of carpet!I bought it in green which was a nice vibrant colour, and the 1.5 lb bag was a good amount. Once finished, it needs to be stored somewhere that will keep in moisture like a sandwich bag or tupperware box.Note: if you have animals in the house, especially dogs, it is important that they are kept away from it. If they ingest it, it can be almost impossible to 'pass' as properties of the kinetic sand cause it to reshape every time the body tries to push it.
column2: This product is one of my favorite inventions! Not only is it a great molding ... // 4.0 // 20 Feb. 2016 // By

column1: Moogs 44 in Wales

on 20 Feb. 2016 // This product is one of my favorite inventions! Not only is it a great molding alternative to the usual molding clay or Play-Dough for children  but it is also a wonderful relaxation toy/tool for adults.The sand particles stick together firmly or softly depending on pressure. We keep it in a sizable container that my son can play in and after playing with it myself over and over, just with my hands  or with a sculpting tool .If I had a criticism  it would be price  - wish it would be cheaper. Noticed on the US site that its the same price in dollars as it is in pounds, suggesting that it could be made a little cheaper for us Brits!

column1: 9 to 5

TOP 500 REVIEWER on 26 Nov. 2015 // This is a great advent calendar with a couple of totally exclusive figures in it...Santa c3po for example there are a couple of ""fillers"" like the fire pit that are not as good as the little Lego characters, but still have merit and help set the Christmas scene.Each of the 24 Windows houses a little plastic bag containing all the Lego pieces that you need to make that days little model  which only takes a couple of minutes to put together. The models then go on the flap that folds down from the front of the box to build up your Lego story scene...the kid in everyone will love setting up these models to tell their story simply because it is so much fun, festive visitors always comment on our Lego advent calendars and somehow seem to end up playing with it, rearranging the scene or modifying the model in some way.The models are your usual Lego quality, fun to build and take part again time after time, the designs are a quirky twist on the usual star wars Lego and the whole thing is great....more expensive than any other of the Lego advent calendars but still great....if you want to try to recoup some money the little men , particularly the limited edition special Lego men are very collectable and have a whole market of buyers who you can sell them to when the new year comes...if you can bear to part with them that is.After all the talk, this set passes the ultimate kid test...they love it, can't wait to open the doors each morning and build that days model , never forget to open the window .Read more ›
column2: A lot of fun // 3.0 // 9 Nov. 2015 // By

column1: Even stevens

on 9 Nov. 2015 // Oh dear the price hikes have started. This is a good Lego calendar. You get lots of lovely little Lego starwars pieces, but you also get some fillers that are a bit of a let down, like the fire for example. The figures are great and on the days when you open the door to reveal R2D2 it puts a smile on your face for the rest of the day, they are definitely the star of the show. The box flap is a great place to build your Lego starwars Christmas scene and no visitors can not resist playing with - many are very jealous and many who don't have one this year will have one next year after seeing mine. Each model is quick and easy to put together - you don't get  instructions with some of the little bags of pieces, but the picture on the front of the box pretty much explains what you need to do. There are several little bags with spare pieces too.It is a great countdown throughout December and a million times better than the cheap chocolate ones.
column2: great way to anticipate christmas // 5.0 // 27 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Amazon Customer

on 27 Dec. 2015 // A wondrous path through the weeks leading to Christmas, for anyone who had his childhood carved by Lucas' images of galaxies far, far away. I just wish there were more characters and less vehicles since there is no detail in the latter and they are very abstract at this scale anyway.
column2: A great little product with a questionable price tag. // 4.0 // 14 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Scott Welsh

on 14 Dec. 2015 // This item is a very good way to count down the days to Christmas.the 24 micro builds inside range from all areas of the galaxy such as; Tatooine, Endor and even the empire.The box itself is very well put together, the doors do stick at times and tend to rip if not opened with care. The instructions for each model can be found on the bak of the windows/doors of the respective day and build.DO NOT expect incredibly detailed builds, however the mini figures are as good a quality as ever and for small builds you really do get a treat vevery day.If you are a fan of Star Wars then this is worth the £20 price tag. however if you are not a big fan of either franchise, then this product could be seen as overpriced.
Amazon Customer

on 28 Dec. 2015 // Another fantastic advent calendar. Yes it may appear expensive, but it is well worth the money for the excitement each day opening the next door. Also, if you consider the number of pieces included, the price isn't too bad.This was our 3rd Star Wars advent calendar, and it didn't start brilliantly as we had  have any idea what the build is! But the rest of the  days were great, especially the last 3.The best thing about this year's is that it is not year specific , so you can always buy this one to use Christmas 2016+.
column2: Only for true Star Wars fans // 3.0 // 16 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Mrs R B Booth

on 16 Dec. 2015 // This is the 3rd year running I have bought a Lego Advent Calendar for my son, but the first year it has been a Star Wars one.He actually chose this over the normal Lego City one he usually has, but I must say I wish he had stuck to what he knows.This just does not seem as exciting as the Lego City ones where you get to build a 'scene'.I would only really recommend this to true Star Wars fans as half of the models - I have no idea what they are supposed to be!
column2: But as precious money was wasted and Lego are still doing just fine // 3.0 // 15 Feb. 2016 // By

column1: Stephen Feder

on 15 Feb. 2016 // Kids tore the box apart to get at the toys and destroyed the advent calendar dimension in the process. That they entirely missed the point of an advent calendar and remain none the wise despite an explanatory telling off is more a factor of their age  than the design of this product. But as precious money was wasted and Lego are still doing just fine, especially with their new movies and what have you, I feel three stars is justified.",""

column1: Su

TOP 100 REVIEWER on 20 Sept. 2013 // *** PLEASE NOTE:  This review will contain content SPOILERS ***I admit that I was a little disappointed with the Lego Friends 2013 Advent Calendar.As with other advent calendars it has 24 windows to open and, in the case of Lego, it has a Lego item or a build behind each door.So why the disappointment?- there are only 2 mini dolls  with the ""City"" and ""Star Wars"" advent calendars you usually get about 8 mini figures so to find that there are only 2 mini dolls in the set was a big disappointment to the Lego fan who received this. ~ Stephanie - blonde - this is a nice figure - lilac cardigan/jacket - pale blue skirt and scarf - white leggings - dark grey boots - nice printing over front torso.~ Lily - 1st appearance in a Lego Friends build - black hair tied in a pony tail - red skirt and leggings  - black boots - white jumper with a red reindeer pattern on it. The Lily figure is very nice, but the recipient thought it was just an Emma variation until we pointed out that it had different hair  so we have decided that Lily must be Emma's sister..Some of the builds are all right and others are ... well it took several of us to try and decide what they were supposed to be :- Christmas tree- snowman - light purple hat and orange/red scarf, comes with a yard brush. There is no face printing.- frozen water fountain.Read more ›

column2: Six year-old heaven - very good kit and rather good ship! // 5.0 // 2 May 2014 // By

column1: Fairy Godmother

TOP 500 REVIEWER on 2 May 2014 // Our six year-old had saved up £7 and wanted me to get the Jek14 minifigure for him.  Except to buy the minifigure on its own was going to cost £16.  No way was I spending £16 on a tiny bit of plastic that wasn't even in the original star wars films!  But I had promised to get Jek 14.  So I ended up paying an extra £38 for this kit.  And it hurt!  It wasn't Christmas or anyone's birthday and we don't want to spoil him.  I physcially groaned for a couple of days after paying for this.  But - it really is good!  Little one got his Jek 14 minifigure, and we all spent some happy family time building the aircraft, which is not for building in a day, but rather over a week or two.  It looks really good when finished and it's the biggest lego ship he's ever had.  I have now said - no more toys until Christmas.  I have to say that although £45 is a heck of a lot to spend on lego, it is kind of worth it and better than spending £60 on lego. We also found it was nicer and more relaxed building a lego kit at this time of year , as everything is so hectic at Christmas and there are so many other things to do.  The pain of spending the money is wearing off a bit now - I'll just have to sell some of his old baby toys to recoup!  The finished ship is about 14"" long and about 13"" wide and is quite impressive to see.  It comes with four minifigures - Jek 14, an R2 type droid, a blue Clone Trooper type thing and a bounty hunter.  The age range says 8 to 14 but our six year old found it a piece of cake to build - if a child under 8 has built a couple of smaller kits before, they could manage this I reckon.  It helped that there were two large  sized instruction booklets with it, with easy to see diagrams spread out in short stages.Read more ›

column1: wiggyman

on 11 Feb. 2016 // I did my homework on all the available sands of this type and gunned for this one, its not only much cheaper than Kinetic sand but you get twice as much! it makes a lovely sand mould and holds its shape, I'm worried that when my boy  next goes to the beach he will be disappointed that the real sand is not as good !  Ive been using this sand inside a stand up table  inside the house, in which it took 6 boxes  to fill, the only one issue I've found is that when it spills over onto my kitchen tiles it seems to leave some kind of residue that makes the floor slippery, which is strange as i once brought a bunch of foam tiles  for baby safety which also left my wooden floors like an ice rink once removed! .  But I'm reviewing the sand itself and id have no problem recommending this motion sand, I'm pushing the kids aside to make sand castles of my own!! ;-) it says the sand is for 3 plus, but my boy is half that age and loves it, he has strong hands which is helpful as this sand does require some hand/finger pressure at times to scoop, dig & mould.  Update - having had it a few weeks now I'm finding that if left a few days without use in a colder room it goes very firm and less dough like which is not a good thing as its harder for my boy to use, so i have to spend time mushing it up to try and make it softer. so not sure if its the cold or what, but ill keep my eye on it.
Cole76
on 26 Jun. 2015 // Fantastic product at great price, quick delivery too. There's plenty here to keep 4 children entertained. Roll it, use cutters, moulds, it's a great alternative to play doh.

Result? = very satisfied, it plays well  - holds its shape when moulded Recommended.
column2: Better than sand and playdoh! Not messy at all! // 5.0 // 8 Jan. 2016 // By

column1: RachelandOliver

on 8 Jan. 2016 // This is great! My children love it; they are 6 and 2. And I love it as it's so easy to play with and not really messy at all! It is much easier to build sandcastles with than regular sand; my two year old has trouble building with regular sand but she can build easily with this.Lots of these reviews say it's messier than playdoh but I don't think it is! The problem with playdoh is that it ends up stuck to my children's bums and socks after they drop tiny bits and sit/stand on it, then it dries, is hard to get off and gets carried on to carpets and furniture.This doesn't stick to hands, clothes, hair, carpets, or anything except itself. If any gets dropped you can just pick up a small ball of it and use that to clean up the little bits.If it is squashed together firmly it is really quite strong and doesn't crumble and fall down like regular sand does making it great for building elaborate sandcastles. It doesn't dry out so I imagine the structures that are built could last for a very long time if you wanted them to.It is like a cross between sand and playdoh but is better than both in my opinion.
Steve K
on 24 Aug. 2015 // 3 year old granddaughter is well pleased with her ""indoor"" sand. Has the consistency of soft brown sugar, doesn't make much mess, is easily molded and stays in shape.
Helena
on 4 Jun. 2015 // This was a brilliant buy. My 5 year old absolutely loves it & it keeps him entertained for hours. I only wish I'd thought to buy 2 packs instead of 1.",""

column1: arethousa

on 21 Dec. 2014 // This looked really good in principle, but after four days of fence panels, and then another couple of days of rabbit hutch panels, topped off by opening yesterdays door to discover only some really lame stickers, my son is quiet dissapointed, and so are we. The animals are very thin on the ground in this box set, its mostly extras for animal play, I was hopeing it would be more balanced, and was quite shocked at the stickers as that wasn't mentioned and really isnt very fair! Buy if you can find it cheaper on offer, but £25 is too much.
column2: Good quality animals as you would expect with schleich // 5.0 // 8 Dec. 2014 // By

column1: Lesley mcgoldrick

on 8 Dec. 2014 // Good quality animals as you would expect with schleich, after xmas was can add all the items to our collection.  Really pleased with purchase.  The only thing I would say is be careful with the door they open v easily causing me to open a few doors early but hardly a deal breaker.

column1: niki

HALL OF FAMETOP 50 REVIEWER on 16 Jun. 2014 // This timer is rather large. I know it was going to be big and as I wanted a little one like this and couldn't find one I settled on this one. It is 6.5 inches in height and 2 3/4 inches wide. The orange salt runs through really quickly and lasts 2 minutes. Great for using to time infusing your tea or use as any type of timer including an egg timer. Quite bright orange, fashionable and looks just like the picture.Looks well made and I do hope it will last, it seems like it will.
column2: Used as a tooth brushing timer // 4.0 // 7 Mar. 2016 // By

column1: SomeoneSomewhere

on 7 Mar. 2016 // Great for using as a tooth brushing timer.  Not incredibly accurate as it's out by a few seconds.  However, I don't think anyone who wanted super accuracy would be turning to this.  We had used the tiny timers in the past but they kept getting dropped, lost and broken in the bathroom.  This is a substantial item which will last a long time.I wish there had been more colour options for the two minute timer, but that's just a minor issue.
Amazon Customer

on 7 Mar. 2016 // Great size, just what I needed, big and easy to see.  Perfect for my 2 year old who struggles leaving the house or moving on from activities, he knows we have to go when the sand runs out.  Has also been used for time out on the naughty step.

on 13 Sept. 2015 // We have a number of these, of different timing lengths and use them for a variety of child related reasons. Brushing teeth, homework, getting dressed, etc. very effective and having checked the time against a stop watch also very accurate.

on 29 Dec. 2015 // does what it says on the tin. 2 minute timer bought for my autistic son who 'needs' to brush his teeth for exactly two minutes. this item has taking the anxiety out of a simple task. decent size and will not break :-)

column1: Sean OToole

on 24 Nov. 2009 // This lego advent calendar is quite a novel product, with each door opening to a lego minifigure or other lego accessory, most of them Christmas based. The entire box contains around 250 pieces, with a great deal of them being special pieces rather than just basic bricks, which makes the calendar even better. The flap of the advent calendar also doubles up as a playmat, with road, snow, some grass and a frozen lake.If you can afford the bigger pricetag than a simple chocolate advent calendar and you have children who enjoy lego, then this is an excellent buy as a countdown to christmas.
column2: Lego City 7687 Advent Calendar // 5.0 // 9 Nov. 2009 // By

column1: Mrs. H.

on 9 Nov. 2009 // I bought last years advent calendar for my two sons, then aged 3 and 5.  They were so excited to open the doors each day that they didn't realise they were counting down the days until Christmas!  I hope this years is as good.
column2: Great product for any age!! // 5.0 // 13 Dec. 2009 // By

column1: The Squirrels

on 13 Dec. 2009 // As always I feel that lego is a bit over priced, however we got this advent calendar at a reduced price and I have to say my three kids love it.  We are only at day 13 so have not opened all the doors yet.The calendar is a great way to encourage the kids to be good during the day so they can open the door at night, they love taking it in turns to open each door and they know from the packaging that they will be getting a santa lego man; we are all having bets to see which door he will be behind.I have to say that Lego is fantastic for little minds.  My son shows me the things he makes and I am always suprised what a great imagination he has with the lego.  I would always recommend any lego product as my children have hours of fun with it.  We adults also get to relive a little of our childhood too!!
pegleg

on 5 Aug. 2010 // I have promised for years to buy my youngest son one of these and finally, at 12, I thought he was too old for this but he loved it.  Expensive  but  I don't spoil him often and he loved it.  Not sure he will find it quite so entertaining a second time though.
column2: Yay! No horrible chocolate - just lots of fun // 5.0 // 27 Jun. 2010 // By

column1: Lovely Treez

TOP 500 REVIEWERVINE VOICE on 27 Jun. 2010 // we have two of these, one for my son which he saved up for when my daughter got one for her birthday. It is certainly a lot more fun than a sickly chocolate and the figures can be recycled in lots of imaginative play - just make sure you keep track of them!
F. Clark

on 22 Dec. 2009 // I bought this for my 10 yo son uuho is Lego crazy... he uuas over the moon uuhen I gave it to him on 1st December... and it's the first thing he does every morning uuhen he gets up. If you have a Lego collector in the family it's ideal because you can choose one to match their particular collection and there's no uuaste at the end of the day. I'll definitely be buying him one next year and Amazon uuas the best price too. :O))  I also managed to get him 2 larger boxed sets on Amazon that I couldn't source anyuuhere else - so he'll be happy on Xmas morning.LEGO® Castle 7036: Dwarves' Mine uuas one of them  - again at a great price!
column2: Who cares if it isn't Christmas? // 5.0 // 13 Jan. 2010 // By

column1: M. Stribley

on 13 Jan. 2010 // Great for all kids, including very big ones and much better than a cheap chocolate advent calendar! You get the usual festive fun in the countdown to Christmas by building a new mini-figure or other item each day and can either re-use next year or add the bits to your existing Lego collection and buy a different one next year. The models are completely non-religious; the Lego City advent calendar features winter-related themes such as snowmen, ice-skating and sledging and secular themes such as Christmas trees and Father Christmas. Some retailers are now selling them for half price...
column2: Not a bit of chocolate in sight ! // 4.0 // 23 Dec. 2009 // By

column1: J. Ruddick
on 23 Dec. 2009 // The children have had lots of fun opening this every day in December.Any Lego Fan would love this.Great alternative to the horrible chocolate advent calender.",""

99d6618b4da48ba5a4ee3d9d9929fb3c,"Playmobil 4163 Advent Calendar Knights' Tournament","Playmobil","47.45","4 new","20","4","4.5 out of 5 stars","","http://www.amazon.co.uk/Playmobil-5493-Christmas-Calendar-Treasure/dp/B00B3QT8FS
column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Playmobil-4161-Advent-Calendar-Christmas-Post-Office/dp/B003AQBW9E","Product Description Christmas has come to Playmobil! The Playmobil Advent Calendar is guaranteed to help the count down and make the days go quicker, behind each door is a Christmas surprise that will add to your Playmobil collection with unusual and exciting accessories. In the Imperial Knights Tournament, Knights of the Lion and robber barons compete on the field before the imperial castle . The winner of the tournament will win a magical golden sword! With gorgeous chrome armour for the Knight of the Lion and accessories. Suitable for children aged four and over as small pieces are included. Playmobil encourages children to imagine, invent and create, creating worlds around their Playmobil friends, inventing characters and scenes, imagining how they interact and what happens next. column1: Ms. Jacqueline Ovigne

on 15 Dec. 2010 // My friend bought this advent calendar for my two boys to share aged 5 and 6. They love it and can't wait to open it each day. I think it is great and will definitely get a playmobil calendar next year.
column2: makes a nice change from the choccie calenders // 5.0 // 13 Dec. 2011 // By

column1: TOBY'S MUMMY

on 13 Dec. 2011 // My boys 3 and 6 love this advent calender.  Every day you get another piece to complete your knights tournament.  This is the first time they have really taken an interest in advent calenders and now they can't wait to open each door. I think for what you get its good value for money as playmobil toys aren't cheap! it includes two knights and two horses all with armour as well as a King and his throne and a prince and lots of little accessories.  I did have to buy one each though to avoid arguments but well worth every penny.
Emmzie

on 10 Dec. 2010 // This style of advent calendar is much better than the traditional ones and you get to keep it afterwards!  My son has been so excited every morning to open the calendar and plays with them every day.  The characters are durable as you expect from playmobil but some of the pieces are a little fiddly and likely to end up in the vacuum cleaner!
column2: Excellent Value For Money // 4.0 // 30 Dec. 2011 // By

column1: Panama84

on 30 Dec. 2011 // Not bought a Playmobil Advent Calendar for a few years now - but so glad I bought this one!Don't think my son is ever going to grow out of knights and these have fantastic armour. The set was slightly fiddly to assemble BUT saying that the overall design of the calendar as a whole was much easier than the last one we had where each box had to be assembled and filled individually.Had lots of interest from friends and relatives!Would recommend these to anyone. Shall be ordering another one next year.
Merton69

on 30 Dec. 2011 // This was bought for my eldest daughter aged 7 who simply loved it.My kids have always got excited opening a chocolate based Advent Calender, so this took it to another level.A very well designed concept that keeps the kids interested.Each 'door' reveals a new toy/part to the scene of choice.Also included is a cardboard fold and set up scene for the parts/toys to be played in.A fantastic idea that went down very well.I am sure this toy will be played with well after Christmas!
column2: Good fun, but over priced // 4.0 // 14 Oct. 2013 // By

column1: MR C .J .CHILTON

on 14 Oct. 2013 // Bought this for my 4 year old son, who loves it.However, afterpaying £40 it was clear I had paid over the odds on this and it can be found much cheaper, so shop around a little more than I did! The same item can be found for as little as £15.....live and learn.
Ms.Fairy

on 1 Jan. 2012 // I will definitely be getting another for both my boys next year my eldest had a lego calender but instead have both played for hours with the toys from this calender! had a really good selection great quality many thanks playmobile! and the delivery was spot on too!
Thomasina

on 8 Dec. 2011 // The advent calendar is interesting and educational to the children and engages them when they assemble it, a day at a time. Like all Playmobil products, it is well made and resistant to damage.",""

Maybe she was a bit too young but she liked it anyway. There were just 2 or 3 times where there were only stickers to be discovered and for the price of the calendar, I think they could have put a little accessory. Overall, it is a good product and would recommend it.

column1: CathyR

on 8 April 2014 // Every year when it comes to buying advent calenders, I grumble at the high cost of the LEGO/Playmobil options - but by Christmas Day, I'm convinced that they are among the best value for money items that I've purchased.If your child likes Lego/Playmobil, then they'll love these calenders, and you can console yourself with the fact that the figures can be integrated into their existing collection once the Festive Season is over.

column1: suzypips

on 21 Oct. 2013 // I must admit to being a tiny bit hooked on these things.You get nice models,opening the 'windows' is always fun as well.You will never get bored because the bricks just get added to the collection.I've found that there are always quite a few duplicate bricks among the sets,which is a nice bonus.Also....don't chuck away the box,there are 24 inner plastic compartments which are ideal for storing the smaller bricks or,as my wife has found out,great for planting seedlings.You really can't lose with these sets!
rosie

on 21 Nov. 2013 // this looks really good so we wanted to get our other grandson one but you are only allowed to purchase one at a time in seven days which wasn't very helpful but the product is really good
column2: The only advent calendar for us! // 5.0 // 7 Dec. 2013 // By

column1: M Poole

on 7 Dec. 2013 // Every year, it's the one advent calendar we absolutely must have.  For around one quid per window, it's a bargain as well as lots of fun making up the various characters or items such as miniature ships.  I've been accused of buying this for myself rather than my son, but what parent would be that cruel?  Of course it's for him!  Absolutely, and unequivocally.There are no disappointments in this calendar, there haven't been any disappointments in the past seven calendars we've had over the years.  Some things are cooler, but nothing is bad or boring or less than fun.  Beats chocolate, any time.
adam
on 9 Dec. 2013 // I brought this for my partner; it's better than having a chocolate calander.For anyone into Starwars this is a nice little touch to December mornings
Little George
on 1 Dec. 2013 // This rating was provided by my 5-year old son after much deliberation.  He was very excited by it and after explaining ratings he made me provide this rating.
column2: for my big  kid // 5.0 // 12 Dec. 2013 // By

column1: Rebecca Cook

on 12 Dec. 2013 // i bought this for my husbands 40th birthday, we got last years calendar and he was thrilled with it, so i had no problem at all buying him this years. the novelty is fantastic, there is a flap that comes down at the front for your models to stand on and the box is decorated with a festive design. he loves to sit down at the table with our children and build the model of the day.we even have a display case on our wall so that the mini figures that come with the sets are on show all the time. a great buy for any star wars lego lover!!
column2: Such a good idea // 5.0 // 3 Jan. 2014 // By

column1: Antonella

on 3 Jan. 2014 // What do you get for your 6 year old son who likes Star Wars minifigures, but is not keen on building Lego?  This calendar was a great present in the build up to Christmas.  There are 24 models, about  half are minifigures of some sort, the rest are very easy to put together battle ships.  Every day was like Christmas day, before going to school.  We got the Lego City calendar for our other son .  On Dec 25 each child only got one present and some books.  Everyone was happy.",""

column1: Jo Bennie

VINE VOICE on 22 Dec. 2009 // My daughter has had these types of calendar for the past 3 years, first a lego one, last year a playmobil forest one and this year the fairy world one.  None has disappointed although the playmobil ones are self assembly and great fun  was had sorting out the instructions.  The calendar is like a large deep box with windows for each day and it comes with a cardboard set, in this case of a fairy wood with rainbows and waterfalls.  This one was better constructed than last year's and the delight on my daughter's face as she opens each door is amazing.  Playmobil's durability and quality are second to none as ever, everything fits as it should.  An absolute delight
column2: Waste of money - Terrible // 1.0 // 1 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: Alex Blewitt

on 1 Dec. 2010 // Bought this advent calendar back in October ready for opening on 1st December. Got the calendar out this morning to a very disappointed 3 year old.... This calendar is self assembly , instructions are rubbish, the cutting line goes the wrong way on the cardboard.We normally like playmobil but this calendar is so bad that I won't be buying another one, I shall be sticking to lego ones in future!
column2: play mobile fairy advent calander // 5.0 // 29 Nov. 2009 // By

column1: Mrs. L. Hulse
on 29 Nov. 2009 // just what i was looking for, only downside, was building the box myself, quite a few bits.
column2: Perfect for girly girls // 5.0 // 16 Jan. 2011 // By

column1: Virginia

on 16 Jan. 2011 // I bought this calendar for my 7 year old daughter who loves Playmobil toys. And she absolutely loved this. One of her present for xmas was the underwater world from Playmobil and she can actually mix the fairies and the mermaid and she has lots of fun. It's a bit expensive but I believe it's worth it and it's much more fun than the traditional chocolate advent calendar. Would recommend it to anyone. If your child loves Playmobil, she won't be disappointed.
Kimmy

on 1 Dec. 2010 // I have to admit, I was more excited than my daughter about this advent calander, and when it arrived I wasn't dissapointed. Unlike other reviewers, all the items were already in the boxes ready to go, so all I had to do was open it, set up the cardboard scene provided, and then let my daughter open day number one!Its lovely, really captures the imagination, my daughter has been playing with the figure she got behind door one all day and can't wait to see whats behind door no.2.oK, its pricier than a conventional advent calander, but its worth it. I'm just counting this as one of her xmas presents, and I will buy her some more fairy playmobil for christmas.
Fair reviewer

on 8 Dec. 2013 // I cannot thank Playmobil enough for having such a wonderful idea. This beats putting chocolate or sweets into the boxes each day. The count down to Christmas is much more fun with the Playmobil figures and children feel they are really being spoiled by getting a proper present each day, . A fantastic incentive.As the collection increases over the 24 days, the fun increases. The good things is that many of the figures , can be integrated with existing Playmobil characters and can be used throughout the year. Not just for Christmas.",""

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Wooden-House-Christmas-Advent-Calendar/dp/B0092741BG","Kids of all ages will love this charming vintage style Advent calendar. It makes a fabulous rustic, retro style Christmas decoration as well as an unusual Advent calendar. Consisting of 24 little wooden numbered houses with an attached string. Each house can be filled with a different treat or two, by lifting the roof, and of course, it can be used year after year.
