column1: Miss R. Frail

TOP 500 REVIEWER on 20 May 2015 // I purchased this on a whim as I thought it would be a fantastic rainy day activity. The advised age range is 3 years+ but I have no issues letting my 17 month old son play with it supervised.The box contains;1 bag of kinetic/motion sand9 moulds - Seahorse, shell, car, plane, train, crab, boat, star, fish1 x roller which creates animal paw printsProps - Hat, 2 x arms, 2 x hands, 1 x eyes,  1 x antennasThe sand consistency is very strange, it is solid when shaped but does run through your fingers as detailed in the attached photo. It is very easy to mould, my son had so much fun filling the moulds and turning them over to reveal the shape. He had a little competition from the adults to play with it so it really is for the whole family to enjoy. The sand as claimed creates little mess and is very easy to tidy as it sticks to itself. The amount of sand received means you can fill 8 of the 9 moulds at one time. I plan to purchase more as my son gets older ... his dad has already been browsing the range online.I highly recommend motion sand, so much fun with no tedious tidy up at the end.I hope this review was helpful.
lianne

on 3 April 2015 // Bought this for my daughter, she loves it,she plays it in her bedroom on laminated flooring and it doesn't make a mess. This product does what it says and i will be buying more from this collection, to add to what she already has.

on 4 April 2015 // My five year old loves this so much! Keeps him entertained for hours. I also use it as a stress buster :) have already recommended it to a few of my friends.

column1: Amazon Customer

on 27 Oct. 2015 // This was £5.99 plus postage earlier in the year, and was an excellent contender to Kinetic Sand due to price and quality.  Fully planned to give as gifts this year, however the seller has gradually increased their price to what is now treble what they were initially selling for!  With this in mind I feel you're better off buying the real Kinetic Sand - the quality is slightly better, the price isn't much different and colours are much more appealing to children.  Such a shame greed steps in and what was a great set is now overpriced.

c15c9b64625ea0bfb308cef602f673f3,"WREATH HOOK SUCTION CUP","Christmas and Decorations","1.99","","22","1","4.1 out of 5 stars","","http://www.amazon.co.uk/Christmas-Wreath-Decoration
column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Garden-Vintage-Plastic-Bunting-Pennant/dp/B009WO3Q9C","This is perfect for hanging your christmas wreath or anything else you can think of. The hook is plastic and stays in place by suction, making it very easy to use and move WITHOUT any mess or fuss. If you find that severe frost has made the suction cup fall off your door then stick it to the inside of your door upside down and tie string from it over your door to your wreath. This method without fail will hold up your wreath. There will possibly be stronger suction cups out there, but we havent seen one yet!!! The powerful suction is produces by the lever action of the hook itself and once on, will require a serious bit of strength to pull it off. These hooks are also great for holidays for hanging up beach towels etc in your hotel or apartment. Available in multi-packs in our store. Please note: This item is designed for use on very smooth surfaces such as glass, glazed tiles or pvc/plastic etc. Other surfaces such as wood or walls will not work as the cup cannot retain suction on uneven surfaces.","Technical Details Manufacturer recommended age:3 years and up Assembly RequiredNo    Additional Information ASINB009LRDSH0 Best Sellers Rank 142,794 in Toys & Games  #163 in Toys & Games > Advent Calendars Delivery Destinations:Visit the Delivery Destinations Help page to see where this item can be delivered. The hook is plastic and stays in place by suction, making it very easy to use and move WITHOUT any mess or fuss. These hooks are also great for holidays for hanging up beach towels etc in your hotel or apartment. Available in multi-packs in our store. Please note: This item is designed for use on very smooth surfaces such as glass, glazed tiles or pvc/plastic etc. Other surfaces such as wood or walls will not work as the cup cannot retain suction on uneven surfaces.","","","Just use a little gel around the edges and you will find the hook stays up fine. The gel I have used is not watwerproof ... // 4.0 // 20 Dec. 2014 // By

column1: RichardGB

on 20 Dec. 2014 // Our front door is not totally flat - it has a raised wood grain effect in it. This means the hook will not stick to for more than 10 seconds BUT there is a very simple solution to this problem. Just use a little gel around the edges and you will find the hook stays up fine. The gel I have used is not watwerproof so it may come down in the rain but if it does I have already decided I will use vaseline next time. Hope this is helpful.Review UPDATE - The hook is cream in colour and our front door is red so it looks odd. We decided therefore to fit the hook upside down on the inside of the door and hang the wreath on a red ribbon which goes over the top of the door and ties to the hook.This works brilliantly. But importantly, when I came to remove the hook from the front door, it was well and truly stuck on - it wouldn't have come off in any sort of weather. So the GEL IS AN EXCELLENT SOLUTION. But for the colour I would give the hook 5 stars.
column2: Waste of time and money // 1.0 // 15 Dec. 2014 // By

on 15 Dec. 2014 // this arrived promptly and in good condition,but........did not stick to glass in my front door;so after my beautiful wreath had smashed to the path several times - I used a little super glue,even this only lasted a couple of hours,when once again the hook and wreath had  smashed onto the door step.I would NOT recommend anyone to purchase this hook suction cap.It has no suction whatsoever.

TOP 500 REVIEWERVINE VOICE on 29 Dec. 2014 // The kids really enjoyed making the sand bottles  in this kit.  The eight packets of coloured sand were plenty for them to use with the funnel and scoop it came with and they were easily able to make stripy patterns.  They didn't really use the supplied tool that fits into the bottle to mix up the sand but you could do this if you wanted to try different effects.Unlike other bottle art we've done before these seem to be quality - the plastic is thick enough so that the sand hasn't all mixed up into a mess of colour.There's rather a lot of packaging, but like every Melissa and Doug craft I've ever tried this kit is great quality, works and children love it.  I will be buying more for birthday presents for the 5-8 range I think as it's great value too.

column1: J. M. Davies

on 20 Dec. 2015 // I buy and send three Alison Gardiner every year for my grandchildren in Spain, an event they look forward to eagerly. Alison Gardiner calendars are amongst the very few that can be posted from the UK to the Continent.  My only negative comment is that choosing the calendars is not easy as the selection does not change sufficiently often to enable me to send three new, different designs each year. Apart from these two negative comments, I like these attractive and traditional calendars and recommend them without hesitation to UK and Continental buyers alike. Jean Davies
Amazon Customer

on 4 Dec. 2015 // This is a lovely traditional picture advent calendar.  My boys have two different designs in this make and they had them last year too.  The numbers are clear enough for my four year old to find and they are interestingly placed rather than being in numerical order or all at the top.  The illustrations are nice too, both fit the main picture and for the ones behind the doors.I will be getting ones from this designer again next year

column1: A Customer

on 11 Sept. 2004 // This advent calender is brilliant, if you want a change from a chocolate calender or if you are really interested in Playmobil. Day by Day you open a box, in the box is a figure, which you place onto the landscape. By Christmas Day you should have all the figures in the right place. Remember you can always move the figures around!To me this advent calender is better than any chocolate one!
Michelle

on 16 Oct. 2009 // We have got these for our two girls now aged 11 and 8 for the past 4 years and they still love them. Considering the cost of playmobil in general we always think these advent calendars are great value. It takes a bit of time to set up as you get a flat piece of backing card with pictures on and then you make up the boxes which takes around 20 mins to put together and these slot on to the flat backing piece. The instructions tell you which piece of playmobil to put in which box. There is a cardboard 'set' which you then put your pieces on each day as you open them. We have had virtually all of them and I can't fault them and they then play with them alongside their other playmobil for the rest of the year.",""

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Playmobil-5493-Christmas-Calendar-Treasure/dp/B00B3QT8FS","Product Description Each of the 24 days brings an accessory for Barbie doll or the girl. The set includes a festive dress for Barbie doll decorated with hearts . column1: The Heppys

on 21 Feb. 2016 // My youngest son has Autism and cannot grasp the concept of time.  We got him this as a normal chocolate advent calendar really confuses him-he thought that if he ate all of the chocolates in one go Santa would come sooner.  Every morning in December when he woke up he was excited to put a bauble on the tree and seemed to understand that when the tree was full of baubles Santa would come.  The calendar is very sturdy and looks so much better than in the picture.  This will last for years to come.
M. Adams

on 29 Dec. 2015 // Absolutely lovely addition to our Christmas decoration collection! Really amazing quality .The tree itself is quite tall  and contains a tray at the bottom  which contains 24 magnets and a magnet star). Each morning, my daughter loved removing a magnet and counting how many 'sleeps till Santa'. Really added to the magic and I can see this product being used for many years to come!

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Motion-Sand-Sand%C2%AE-2000g-Pack/dp/B00V3HCWEG","Have endless hours of fun with this deluxe playtray playset, creating brilliant sand shapes or create your own sculptures. Motion Sand® is the squeezable sand where you can FEEL the fun! Pack it, pull it, shape it and love it, Motion Sand is so incredible you can't put it down. It's kinetic - meaning it sticks to itself and not to you! It's easy to shape and mould and flows through your fingers like a slow-moving liquid, but leaves them completely dry. Kinetic Sand stimulates children's creative skills allowing them to create anything they can imagine. It never dries out and is gluten free. This soft and stretchy sand easily cleans up while delivering non-stop fun! It's squeezable sand you can't put down. The deluxe playtray playset includes Motions Sand®, 10 dinosaur moulds and play scene tray. For ages 3 years and over. on 26 Mar. 2016 // Bought this as a special treat for my 4 year old nephew and he absolutely loved it! I was a bit worried that the pieces would be too small for him but he found them easy to use and loved putting all the flowers in place. The smallest pieces are the eggs, which I was a bit wary about, but these are all moulded together so wasn't a problem.He was very excited to open the doors each day, it was just like Christmas! The Easter rabbits are also a great addition to his growing Playmobil collection and a great alternative to chocolate. I would definitely recommend this product to any Playmobil fan!!.

column1: E M

on 11 Sept. 2015 // I agree with previous reviews that say that this is extremely expensive for what you get. The front picture is very misleading as the amount of sand you actually get is about a quarter of what is pictured. I also bought my daughter a separate refill pack to bulk it out a bit which turned out to be a good  move. That said, it is the most fascinating stuff I have come across! I've no idea how it works, but it is great to play with. The kids are addicted to it and I have to confess to having a shot of it myself!
Stucumber

VINE VOICE on 2 Nov. 2014 // I was pretty disappointed with this product as it doesn't live up to the impression given by the box art.First off the tiny hand gives a false impression of size, this thing is less than a foot square, not the large looking tray depicted. Secondly, the tray in the photo is packed with sand, the box you receive bears small print  which advises that photo shows 2lb of sand, not the supplied 1lb, so that, not only is the tray small it is less than half full.The Kinetic sand itself is interesting stuff, and our boy has found it fun to play with, however the small size of the tray does mean the stuff escapes and unless you're vigilant can make a mess. The moulds  work well and the sand retains its shape and can even be shaped to a small degree in the hand, though unless it's supported will lose its shape quickly.On the subject of mess, I can't understand why a lid wasn't included, we've resorted to using a carrier bag to put the tray in but this isn't entirely suitable as if the box gets accidentally turned upside down it makes a bit of a mess.Something I didn't consider was the environmental impact of this stuff, when it gets into the environment, as it is polymer coated sand, I can't think of a suitable method of disposal; the tray and moulds are at least recyclable. Still thinking of the environment, it is worth noting the distances involved in the manufacture and transport of the components. The sand is made in Europe, the plastics in Canada, both are then shipped to Mexico to be assembled, before shipping back out before sale.Overall, there is potential for a good toy here, though I feel I've been deceived by misleading marketing.
column2: Much smaller tray than it appears on the box. // 3.0 // 29 Nov. 2014 // By

column1: Richard Hammond

column1: Ginger

VINE VOICE on 21 Oct. 2014 // If you are impressed by the illustration on the box you will be disappointed with the actual contents!The moulds are tiny, not made from a very sturdy plastic and the sand is difficult to remove intact from the castle mould.You only get one colour, purple so to make play more interesting you will need to buy other colours from the range, personally I will not be doing that because the novelty has already worn off after an hour or so with a 4 year old who called the set ""silly"". Out of the mouths etc. etc.I really didn`t find the tray very useful because it is just over 20 mm deep and the sides are not even straight, thankfully I put a plastic tablecloth underneath. The kinetic sand is just okay, a bit funny to the touch but nothing special. I can see these moulds being used with Play dough more than anything else.Another small point is the packaging, it`s difficult enough to find anything in English on the box but when removing the tape from the side opening part of the instructions peeled of as well. I cannot justify the price for what you get here and do not recommend, sorry.
Bill W

TOP 500 REVIEWER on 22 Nov. 2015 // This is a good 'novelty' product for children who are perhaps more accustomed to more usual toys. It is certainly different and it has a real novelty value that is guaranteed to grab and hold their attention.The box contains a bag of sand, a tray and four moulds. The sand itself is basically sand mixed with a harmless polymer and a bright purple dye. The polymer makes the sand grains stick together slightly so if you pack it into a mould the sand holds the shape of the mould for a while. The adhesion gradually breaks down and the sand shape slowly falls apart into semi-loose grains again. It's a bit like playing with damp sand on the beach but the sand is more 'sticky' and the polymer helps give any moulded shape greater definition.The polymer itself is clean and odour-free. The sand has no distinct smell and it doesn't leave any sticky residue on your hands. It doesn't stick to carpets or solid surfaces or anything. If you do get any on the carpet you can just vacuum it up.The sand is coloured bright purple although you can buy lots of other colours separately if you want . For some reason the manufacturers chose bright purple as the standard colour to be used in the basic kit. In my opinion this was a questionable choice as some of the other more subtle colours are visually more appealing.You get one imperial pound  of sand in the box. This isn't very much and you will probably find yourself buying more separately. Additional sand is expensive; currently  over £12 for a random coloured one pound bag on Amazon and up to £25 for a one pound bag of specific coloured metallic sand. I would advise you to be aware you could easily end up spending more than you think buying more of this product to maintain its 'playability'.Read more ›",""

column1: 43emz

on 16 Mar. 2016 // My son absolutely loves Kinetic Sand, it is so easy to mould, has a unique texture that retains it's shape when you make a mould with it.  he loves making little gold bars with this gold sand.  It's not as sparkling gold as on the packaging but it's still a nice shade, it looks a lot like real sand so it is the most realistic looking play sand that I've seen, you can make sandcastles with this that look like they're straight off the beach.  It doesn't stain your carpet and is easy to clear away, just scoop it up and put back in the bag, it retains it's soft texture.  If there are any spillages simply sweep them up or hoover them.  As it is so easy to use it is the perfect toy for children with sensory needs as it boosts their creativity and confidence.  Hours of fun with this play sand.  Highly recommended

column1: liz

on 19 Jan. 2015 // Fantastic quality, as with all playmobil products. A delight to open and discover what is behind each door.Some of the doors open to reveal toys that aren't exactly thrilling e.g. a fence/a sack of reindeer food. Although this is to be expected, playmobil could number the doors differently so that the less thrilling toys aren't one day after the other.Father Christmas is behind door number 24. It is a long wait... As Playmobil is a German company and German children celebrate St Nikolaus on 6th December, maybe that would be a more appropriate date for Father Christmas to appear?

column1: Drew Maughan

on 12 Sept. 2011 // I bought this advent calendar a couple of weeks ago, having seen it on sale, and initially thought it was very lightweight for the price. I'm not a fan of the recent City Police theme , but the kids will probably like this calendar for the playability each model and minifigure brings.There are two models in the calendar that will be built over more than one day, and unlike last year's advent calendar you'll have to wait until each model is completed before you can effectively play with them.If your kids like City Police then this advent calendar is a great choice, otherwise it might be better to invest in another set.
column2: Christmas Fun with Lego! // 5.0 // 5 Jan. 2012 // By

column1: Hon Guin Lee

on 5 Jan. 2012 // Having seen from other people enjoying this year's Lego City Advent Calendar and at less than £20, I couldn't resist to purchase this product.Having purchased and the product delivered on time for Christmas, Lego City Advent Calendar failed to disappoint, you get a LEGO police building, a LEGO police car, two snow mobile, 6 figurines including two police, two robbers, a fisherman and Santa with a dog. Using the advent calendar box as the backdrop, you can place the LEGO pieces on the cardboard part of the box, and can be enjoyed by friends and family opening the advent flaps counting to each day. So much so that I bought another one for next year already.I would strongly recommend this LEGO City Advent Calendar especially at the price of £15.15 from coolclearance!
Rachel.

on 21 Sept. 2011 // I bought this for my son. My husband loved it ..... There seemed to be loads of men and trees and some days you get a couple of bit for your city. Husband loved it that much he plans on using as his advent calendar every year.
column2: Lego City Advent Calendar - Better than Chocolate // 5.0 // 31 Dec. 2012 // By

column1: Alessi Lover

TOP 500 REVIEWER on 31 Dec. 2012 // I bought this for an avid Lego fan .  It went down a lot better than a selection box and what is more, certainly more playable with.  The figures are so cute and the dinky looking dog, think that was my favourite of all.  Now this is the City range but like all Lego themed ones you can reuse these figures in any other combinations you wish .  You do not have to be a child to play with this Advent calendar just have some imagination and anything can be made.Lots of different mini figures that are contained in a cardboard cutout advent calendar.  Yes I did think that maybe the box could have been better designed, as it soon gets a dog eared look about it with it being just that cardboard.  I suppose that if the box was made of plastic or such the price would go up, but at the end of the day it is not just the packaging but the mini figures that you buy it for.  And the guessing of which figure it may be hiding behind which door.But compared to buying lots of mini figures it works out cheaper and a lot more healthier to the teeth than chocolate.  Plus the fun of guessing what is what is half the fun too.I did the stupid thing though of making it a Christmas present.  Should have made it an early one then the days could have be opened like a traditional advent calendar, rather than son wanting to start on Christmas Day then having to open all the previous day ones.  So best to give it as an early December the 1st present.I would buy another one but in a different range next time as son knows what is in this one so not as big surprise.
column2: Lovely idea for older kids // 4.0 // 22 Dec. 2011 // By

column1: Smiles

on 22 Dec. 2011 // I bought this advent calendar for my eldest son who is 4 1/2, thinking that we would have loads of fun building the scene up together day by day, and that I'd be able to bring it out again next year, and the next and the next in what would become a lovely family tradition.Er... no!The calendar does build into a nice scene, with a fisherman sitting by a fire fishing in the lake, and some christmas presents under the christmas tree, a skateboard with helmet etc. or a not so nice scene depending on the way you look at it, with bank robbers using a snowball flinging device to fend off the cops and keep themselves out of the jailhouse, and so on.  But the pieces are soooooo tiny, and so numerous it's impossible to avoid them getting lost , hoovered up or plain old eaten by my 18month old!  It's the 22nd of December today and we probably have about 200 tiny pieces of lego from this set in a tuperware box , and we've still got another couple of days to go!On a plus side, both my boys have loved making other things with the tiny lego bits.  My eldest makes really good space ships, and my 18month old enjoys experimenting with multiple head transplants stacked onto the baddie's body.  So they've had loads of entertainment from this toy - just not the sort I had originally planned, but then again, I should know better by now.  And I think when it's used like this -  to make different things - it is quite educational.  But is it durable - I'm afraid not.Read more ›",""

column1: 43emz

on 16 Mar. 2016 // I purchased this box of Kinetic Sand for my 7 year old son as he likes to play in the sand and this is perfect for indoor play without making  mess .  He absolutely loves it.  The sand has a unique texture in that unlike real sand, it retains it's shape so you can make moulds of it very easily and it stays in that shape as long as you want it to.The inflatable tray is a great idea as it gives it a beach like quality - you can almost imagine you are playing with sand on the beach.  The only thing is I left it inflated all night and my kitten must have punctured it so now I cannot re-inflate it but I still use it as a play mat.  The set comes with 4 large bags of sand, 10 mounds, 2 cylinder makers and a couple of handy cutters, together with a pump to inflate the play mat.The sand is high quality, I have used the original Kinetic Sand before and this is of comparable quality, if anything it is slightly easier to mould as it has a firmer texture.  My son has sensory needs and therefore he is not keen on messy play but he has absolutely no problems at all making things with this sand and using the moulds, even with limited  fine motor skills, he makes the moulds perfectly and is really pleased with himself which boosts his confidence and self esteem, it's nice to find a creative toy that is so easy to use.  I would recommend this to any child with sensory needs as the texture is soothing to them in the same way as thera-putty but with this you can be much more creative with all the different shapes e.t.c .  My son loves me helping him make things too and we build walls together using the wall mould and then make little animals to put inside of the walls.  He enjoys spending quality time with me playing sand and showing me what he can build.Read more ›
column2: If normal sand and play doh had a love child... // 4.0 // 2 Mar. 2016 // By

column2: Best toy we have bought for ages. // 5.0 // 18 Feb. 2016 // By

column1: Sherry Palmer

on 18 Feb. 2016 // I've seen kinetic sand a few times on the internet. I knew my daughter  would love it and I was interested to see the claim of 'no mess' first hand. We have a sand pit in the garden but never get to use it due to the weather. It also makes a mess and she gets covered in it.We were both excited when the Wizard sand was delivered. I appreciate any toy that comes with its own storage box and I think the inflatable sided tray is a really good idea to keep the sand contained. The pump was pretty useless and broke instantly revealing little parts and a tiny ball bearing. It went straight in the bin. It isn't really needed since it took less than a minute to blow up with lung power. Now if you're paying full whack for this kit a cheap plastic pump that doesn't work is going to be pretty disappointing.The sand itself comes stored in resealable bags. Only the cheap type you can buy in abundance from shops but still, it's nice for packaging to not be wasted. You get 4 x 500g. I checked out some other kits out of interest. This set Kinetic Sand Box Set contains a cat litter type tray and must only include 400g of sand since with the tray and 4 moulds the entire box weighs 490g for £20. So 4 x the amount of sand and lots of molds and tools in the Wizard kit is pretty good.There are plenty of molds but these are only cheap plastic. I have tons of these lying around anyway so you'd need to ask yourself whether you can do without 10 molds and lots of tools when you could just find these lying around and buy the sand on its own for less money.My daughter loved the sand. It is a really impressive product on its own.Read more ›",""

column1: Raspberrygiggle

on 11 Nov. 2015 // Because the sand doesn't stain and is non-toxic, it is perfect for being able to play with indoors during the winter when you can't get to the beach to make proper sandcastles!I did find it relatively mess free and, any mess that was made could be swept up easily though I will only let my children play with it in the dining room where there is no carpet.I liked that the set had a good sized tray included to play with the sand.  There was plenty of space in the trays to make plenty of sculptures and still left plenty of space for them to play with the sand.  I would have liked to have seen lids for the trays to be able to store the sand easier.The quality of the plastic modelling tools provided is great.  The plastic is strong and will stand up to a lot of play.Although Sands Alive claims to look and feel like real sand I don't really agree.  It definitely feels more like a modelling sand than real sand which is not a bad thing.  It does, however, look more like sand than other sets we have had in the past as it is sand coloured.My 7 year old son found the sand very easy to model both with his hands and with the moulds provided.  My 3 year old daughter struggled a little, though still had fun playing with the sand.The sand came out of the moulds very easily and I was really impressed with how much detail was imprinted onto the sand.Once my son had made the sculptures they did stay standing until he knocked them down to pack the sand away.  The sand does stick together very well.For the price, I think the set is excellent value for money.  You receive plenty of sand and a lot of moulds to play with.Read more ›

column1: ДД²

on 5 Dec. 2015 // ★ PLAYMOBIL★ 5494★ 2015★ AGE GUIDE : 4-10 ★ 101 pc★ Assembly instruction booklet includedI always pop a chunky advent calendar in my basket to have from Amazon, and when the price decreases ; I place the order, which happened in October this year.The colourful, quality box measures around 40 cm x 30 cm x 8 cm overall and comes in a strong outer carton for safe transit.◄ SPOILER ALERT! ►Like a box of crackers, the box has a cardboard overlay detailing the contents, day-by-day, which I have gone on to show in my images to give an idea of the content this year.  I discard this layer when giving as a gift so the recipient doesn't  know what to expect behind each window.  If it is opened carefully, there is no evidence of this.Underneath, on one side of the box is a tree-framed, snowy scene with a path meandering off into the distance with an inbuilt hanger to put on a wall, if required.  If just standing the calendar on a flat surface, which is quite successful due to its depth, the hanger just looks like the moon in the wintry night sky and doesn't spoil the scene.On the other side are the advent calendar windows, showing Santa & his elves, busy with preparations and loading the sleigh, watched over by an angel.  The windows vary in sizes and the numbers are easy to spot, each surrounded by a bright yellow star.  They are relatively easy to open, by depressing and pushing back on the tab, and then tear the perforations.  The rewards occasionally need basic assembling, adding to the fun.The contents are designed to go on the colourful backdrop - the base of which measures around 46 cm maximum x 24.Read more ›

column1: Cookieland

on 29 Dec. 2015 // My sister made me an advent calendar back in 2004 out of matchboxes, papier mache and the Playmobil nativity sets, after all this time it is getting rather battered and loved but my two young children adore it. I was delighted to discover Playmobil made their own calendars a few years ago but at the time the price was out of my range and I didn't think it looked like you got much inside for the price. How wrong was I! On the spur of the moment I ordered this the last week of November, my husband was not impressed when he realized I had spent nearly £25 on an advent calendar/Seasonal toy. However when it arrived one look on the back of the box swayed him. Note: Don't let the recipients of the calendar see the back of the box for it shows you what you receive behind each door! Each door holds something for Santa's workshop, e.g a blue basket with six teeny tiny animal figures , a wheelbarrow and teddy bear, carrots for the reindeer, a ""present"" with toy racing car. There are four little card boxes behind various doors which you need to fold up into presents. This advent calendar comes with four figures - An angel, two elves and Santa himself , all hidden behind a different door. Inside the box there is a beautiful cardboard backdrop, you have to pop out some parts and fold it to make it stand. It really is gorgeous and the children loved setting up the scene each day. The card game you get is just a little box with a simple game of snap  inside. I think my children would have preferred an extra toy for the grotto but it is a nice idea. I will definitely be buying these annually. The excitement on my bairns faces each morning was wonderful and something you would not be able to get from a chocolate calendar. Plus they have a beautiful toy to get out every Christmas.
column2: We all loved it. Bit tricky keeping all the bits together ... // 5.0 // 31 Dec. 2014 // By

column1: MrsM

on 31 Dec. 2014 // First time I have bought one. We all loved it. Bit tricky keeping all the bits together especially with small kids, but I managed it by only really letting them play with it Xmas eve when it was complete . The doors are quite firm so smaller kids need a bit of effort to open them. I had to open the door for my 3 year old to break the perforations then close it for her to open in the morning. As I have all the bits, it may be back again next year and I can mix up all the pieces for them. I will be looking to see what other ones there are too.",""

column1: Raspberrygiggle

on 11 Jun. 2015 // We were sent this in return for our honest review.The set is aimed at children aged 4 and above which I would agree with.  It is not something I would let my two year old daughter play with yet as I know she would become bored easily and end up making a mess instead!When the set arrived I didn't think it looked like there was much sand in the bag to play with, however, once tipped into the tray there was plenty there to keep my son happy.He got stuck straight in, squeezing the sand together and moulding it into shapes.  He enjoyed using the roller and tools, however, I felt there could have been a couple of moulds included to keep his attention for longer.  These can be bought separately but it would be nice to have one or two included in this set.I was happy to let my 6 year old son play with the sand indoors as it is fairly mess free.  Although he wasn't always careful to keep the sand in the play tray, what he did spill on the table was easy to clean back up into tray and I didn't find that any stuck to the furniture or the floor.I was impressed with the quality of the play tray and tools provided and feel the set provides good value for money.  I was also pleasantly surprised that the sand fit back into the bag provided with little effort as that saved me having to have an extra storage tub - everything fits back into the box provided.Overall we are pleased with the Cra-Z-Sand Deluxe Play set and would definitely recommend it as a fun way to play with sand relatively mess free!
M. Mohamed

VINE VOICE on 8 Jun. 2015 // Cra-Z sand is a lot of fun. It's pretty similar to kinetic sand, and sands alive in the way that it molds and moves. It is less messy than normal play sand since it sticks together differently and you won't get little sand grains all over the house, so if you are playing indoors then this is better.The set includes enough cra-z sand to play with  and a tray to use while playing, plus a couple of tools like a roller and shaper but not any molds for making sandcastles or shapes. You can use any of your own sand molds though or even a cup, they will all work fine and this cra-z sand molds really well, keeping its shape better than normal sand. It is quite similar to moon sand or moon dough in the way that it moldsMy children all enjoy playing with this, ages 3, 5 and 6
Gideon BrimmerTania Ramos

on 27 Mar. 2016 // Not happy with this purchase. My daughter was keen to sculpt pyramids and walls and the box clearly shows these, with a vague description of 1 tray, 1 roller and 3 shaping tools.The three shapes sand sculptures on the front  are photographed with the tray and roller. There is no disclaimer next to these stating moulds not included.A separate image of a fish mould has a small disclaimer of no mould included. This is unacceptable and bad marketing.The included tools are all flat and the included instructions describe how to fill a mould NOT INCLUDED and use the shapers to clean the sand away.I am not impressed! There should be a clear label on the front of the box that the shapes are not included.1.5lb of sand, a cat litter tray and three bits of flat plastic are sadly not worth the money.I would send this back immediately, but unfortunately the Easter Bunny bought it and my daughter opened the product. She was disappointed that the pyramid was missing, I'll now have to look for one online.
column2: Beware, the quantity is not what you would expect for the price // 3.0 // 12 Jan. 2016 // By

This glitter is perfect for glued glitter writing on all sorts of products should you wish to glitz up personalised gift bags for Christmas or even your party balloons. Colour awareness - due to screen resolutions/differences, the colours of the glitter seen may be slightly different from the actual colour delivered. column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Playmobil-5496-Advent-Calendar-Christmas/dp/B00IF1W4KK","Cool! The brand new boy and girl themed Advent Calendars! Advent Calendar Pirates comes with a backdrop that can be hung on the wall. The Advent boxes are numbered and can be easily hung on the backdrop. Directions are included on how to set up the calendar and which items go in each box. This Christmas set has background for imaginative play once all the boxes are opened. The cornerstone of all Playmobil activities is the two and three quarter inch figure which can bend, sit, stand, turn its head and move its arms. The hands, which can grasp, rotate and carry accessories, are what make realistic play possible. The figures also have a smiley face that suits just about any play situation. All Playmobil men, women, children and animals are compatible will all other Playmobil vehicles, accessories and environments. The bright colors and rounded edges are appealing to children. And, the unique construction features locking-grid building pieces that allow children to quickly and easily change their play worlds by creating new buildings. With numerous themes to choose from in a variety of age-appropriate settings, Playmobil is dedicated to enriching the lives of children by encouraging them to use their imaginations. on 12 Feb. 2016 // This was a fabulous purchase for my 4 year old, he absolutely loves it and has played for hours with it. It is a pliable 'dough like'  sand which can be used with moulds and stamps to create castles or anything else your child can think of.  It comes with a good selection of moulds, a roller and a couple of stamps to help create pretty cool looking castles as per the box!The sand itself is excellent. There were two large packs in the box and it does not dry out as claimed  by the manufacturer.Overall this was an excellent gift for my son! He loves sand and 'play doh'  and since this is like those two things mixed together, it is ideal!My only concern when buying was the mess it would probably make and while it does come with a reasonably large tray, the sand does get everywhere. It is however pretty easy to clean up, because it doesn't dry out, it also doesn't embed in your carpets. It takes a little more hoovering   it does clean up well. On tables and chairs it can just be wiped off back into the tray. It leaves and off residue in your hands also but this is removed with washing.I did find that there wasn't anything I could really do with the sand once my son had finished playing with it but I found a plastic tupperwear box that it fit into perfectly.I do think however that the product would be even better if the tray doubled as a sealable box, i imagine it wouldn't take much to refashion the tray so that it could support a lid.Even with storage issue, it is an excellent product and my son loves it! We are hoping to try out the other moulds in other packs soon!
Suze S
on 7 April 2016 // The sand is a bit messy and sticks to hands and carpets. Other brands are much superior so worth spending a little more if you can. Still fun and fast delivery.

Louise Jessica Blewitt

on 7 April 2016 // The manufacturer must have changed the chemical composition of this powder  because it is a nightmare... when it gets in the carpet it's difficult to get out. This stuff doesn't perform at all like it's supposed to , it doesn't stick to itself as claimed but it does stick to fabrics with an alarming persistence, as my wife's skirt still bears witness. I couldn't even get it out of the carpet with a vacuum cleaner, I had to rub it with a brush first and even then it still needed the pet hair attachment of the vacuum cleaner before it came out . If I seem annoyed about this product it's because I am, it's taken me ½ hour so far to try cleaning up after this laughably claimed 'no mess' modelling sand'.I can only compare the residue this Sands Alive makes to that of plaster of Paris and although the sand material is not as fine it embeds itself in fabrics just as much. In the carpet, cushions and clothes, all of which needed cleaning afterwards. It even gets under the fingernails... my son drinks out of a plastic tumbler and all around outside was covered in a dried powdery residue,  and that was easy to clean.This is the second Sands Alive set we've bought in the last fortnight, the first was the animal set, John Adams Sands Alive Animal Set reviewed separately, and neither of them perform at all like the squidgy sand in the promo videos; there is no clumping and no self-binding.Read more ›",""

column1: April Wallis

on 19 Feb. 2013 // This jedi star fighter is nearly a tenner more than the Plo Koon set, or the Mace Windu set from a few years ago, but having built it, it is actually BIGGER and more sophisticated than these earlier models, so that explains the price. I guess as Saesee Tinn is an ace jedi pilot, he naturally gets a bigger ship.It comes with 2 instruction books, as there are enough pieces to split the build into 2 parts. Our 7 year old has built the first instruction books worth with very few errors on his own - so not such a tricky build for this age group, but tricky enough to still remain a challenge. The cockpit detaches as an escape pod, so that also explains the 2 part build.Compared to the other star fighters, it looks really cool. It has several moving parts, landing gear, cockpit cover and flick missiles. It is still smaller than the super dooper size models and as such has great swooshing potential, without too much risk of falling apart. I really like the size of these star fighter models, as they will fit easily into a plastic storage box or onto a shelf for display.Comes with 3 collectable mini guys . There are 2 great jedi from the clone wars plus the green astromech R5 D5. Even Piell - the one with the big floppy ears and eye patch, is unique to this set and Saesee Tinn - the one with horns, is only available in 2 other expensive sets. . So all in all worth the little extra cost.

column1: Anne

on 12 Jan. 2013 // The Lego is good quality. Very expensive but buying from Amazon was slightly less than in shops. Very prompt delivery and in perfect condition. Perfect for 9 year old Star Wars fanatic, took a good hour to make it on Christmas morning, very absorbing with clear instructions.

on 28 Oct. 2013 // Easy to put together, bigger than expectedmy son adores it and plays with it all the time.Would recommend

on 22 Sept. 2013 // My sons loved building it and its one of his favourites. He likes the opening on top too. Colours are great.
column2: Simple, but fairly effective // 4.0 // 20 Nov. 2012 // By

column1: Chelsea

on 20 Nov. 2012 // A fun little piece with some minifigures that I haven't seen elsewhere, so if that's what interests you then I'd recommend buying this one.The build isn't TOO complicated, so if you're wanting a complex and interesting build, this one might not be for you. However, if you're looking for a smaller piece to display, then this one fits in quite nicely. Especially since the landing gear means it sits quite nicely on a shelf.In terms of playing with it, there's a decent amount it can do for its size. It has the usual flick missiles, and a place to hold the lightsabers when the Jedi is in flight, and there's even an escape pod with this one, so there are a few scenarios you can set up with it.Overall, not my favourite piece since I like complex and interesting builds, however it's a welcome addition to my collection and I think it would be fun for a younger builder to play with.

column1: Ed Meister

VINE VOICE on 29 Sept. 2015 // This is a great model, my 7 year old Son first saw it at a friends and once I tracked it down it is a firm favourite having been pulled apart and rebuilt on numerous occasions now. Detailed in every way.

column1: Kit

on 1 Dec. 2014 // Excellent product that works very well.  I purchased this for my 5 year old and he and his older brother have used it a lot.  It sticks well together, and I consider the materials added to be safe for my children.One challenge is where to store the sand - it's for indoors play but it can still make a mess on the carpet.  If bits fall on the carpet, the larger bits can be picked up but the small bits need the vacuum cleaner to come round.  We have used a large biscuit tin to store it in, but unless the kids play in a very tranquil way they end up spilling over onto the carpet.  I've made an order for a mixing tray to solve that problem:  MIXING TRAY, CHILDREN'S PLAY MAT, SAND PIT, WATER, PLASTIC, TOYS, POOL PIT, Update:  I decided to purchase a second kinetic sand pack for Christmas since I'm buying a mixing tray which gives extra playing space.  At the time of writing there are two sellers, in-stock seller at £33 and Amazon out of stock at £15.  I purchased the out of stock Amazon one on 6 December 2014 and received it just a few days later on 11 December 2014.  However it is still showing out of stock on Amazon today .  Given the price difference I strongly suggest to buy from Amazon even if it shows out of stock.

on 2 Nov. 2009 // I bought my kids this calendar last Christmas and they very much enjoyed having it and were very excited to open it each morning. column9: http://www.amazon.co.uk/LEGO-Star-Wars-TM-75136/dp/B012NOJSKI","Is this the 2014 Lego star wars advent calendar? // Hello, yes it is, got mine a few weeks ago.
column10: How big are the little packets of construction bits roughly  // To be quite honest I never open mine, I keep them boxed. However I know that they will go in thestocking type advent calendars with pockets as I have seen that done by someone else.
column11: Are the minifigures the ""normal"" size? It looks like the vehicles are micro sized so are the figures to fit these - or the traditional Lego kits? // The figures are regular Lego size although the vehicles are smaller so the figures do not fit inside.
column12: could someone tell me what the figurines are in the 2014 calender. As I dont want to double up!. Thanks. // Sorry, no idea apart from the picture on the box, as they won't be all opened until Christmas day.
column13: do the 2014 & 2015 calenders look the same // Hi generally each year is different so would assume 2015 has new stuff in it.
column14: We had the Lego Star Wars advent calendar last year.  Is it worth getting this 2014 version or will a lot of the figures be the same as last year? // I got last years and there are definately different figures this year.
column15: roughly how big are the ships?? // Around 2 inches or so... no bigger than the actual Lego figures themselves.","Darth Vader Santa! // 5.0 // 1 Oct. 2014 // By

TOP 500 REVIEWERVINE VOICE on 1 Oct. 2014 // The all new Lego Star Wars advent calendar is an absolute winnerThere are so many desirable items in this set.My personal faves:- Darth Vader Santa!- Tiny land speeder- Light sabre fireplace- Droid Christmas Tree- Tie Fighter and pilotIt is shame there isn't a Leia, but otherwise this is a truly excellent advent calendar for any Lego Star Wars fan.  All relatively easy to build, albeit a bit tricky for younger children, and definitely healthier than chocolate.Five stars.

on 21 Oct. 2014 // Brilliant as always.  I buy one every year for my son who's now 36 and my 12 year grandson. Good value and great fun.

column9: http://www.amazon.co.uk/LEGO-Friends-41094-Heartlake-Lighthouse","","Worst of the Lego advent calendars. // 2.0 // 9 Nov. 2015 // By

column1: Even stevens

on 9 Nov. 2015 // Arrgh I love Lego and find myself giving this a 2 star rating, this pains me. The reason for this is I honestly feel that Lego are short changing us with this years calendar. We have only got 2 figures and as lovely as they are the Lego City and the Lego Star wars calendars both have more, but even more unforgivably there is no Santa figure- What are you thinking Lego- Christmas without the big man??Some of the models in this are too pink and twee- just because it is aimed at girls do we really have to have a pink skadoo?Some models are great, but I want to see microscopes and stethoscopes rather than a hair brush and hair dryer.Come on Lego don't short change the girls, give us a Santa and the message that we are worth more than pretty hair and singing and dancing next year.
column2: Come on Lego give us Santa // 3.0 // 9 Nov. 2015 // By

column1: 9 to 5

TOP 500 REVIEWER on 9 Nov. 2015 // This is a great idea for an advent calendar, it is unashamedly aimed at little girls who like to build and generally play with Lego  and the little windows each hold a complete model to build each day.Some of these are very small and in all honesty just fillers with the star of the show being the little dolls, I think that there should have been a Lego Santa in here - which there isn't. It seems ridiculous for him to be missing at Christmas, especially since there is a Lego Santa in the Lego city advent calendar and a Lego C3Po dressed up in a Santa Suit in the Lego starwars advent calendar. The scene that this builds in really sweet and there is even online additional games for you to ""unlock"" as the month progresses  This year I have bought 3 Lego advent calendars- Star Wars, City and this one and I can honestly say that for the best value for money and models the Lego City calendar  wins it hands down in my opinion.
column2: Build and play all the way to Christmas // 5.0 // 6 Sept. 2015 // By

column1: LegoGirl

on 6 Sept. 2015 // Lego releases 3 different versions of their Advent Calendar each year, and this Friends model is the ""girly"" one. As usual there are lots of fun mini-models to assemble and place on the box's play area, including 2 dolls. Whether you buy the City, Friends, or Star Wars version of the advent calendar set, you'll have fun counting down the days in December all the way to Christmas!This is the 2015 model from Lego---they release new advent calendars every year---but it's simply designated for days 1-24 so you could use any of the sets from year to year. To re-use the calendar, make sure you carefully pop open the perforated windows so you'll be able to re-close them for next time. Buy early, Lego sells out of these calendars quickly!
column2: Good but last years was better // 4.0 // 1 Jan. 2016 // By

column1: Hp

on 1 Jan. 2016 // We love all things lego and this is no exception. The day to day bits are cute and easy for my 3&6 yr old to follow and build. I think last years was better as there were a few things this year that were a bit naff.2 recommendations firstly buy a big base to clip everything on to else you end up with lot of little bits getting lost. Secondly before you throw the box away tear off the doors as these have the building pictures and come in handy next year when you want to rebuild the broken things.
column2: Lots of play value // 5.0 // 6 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Amazon Customer

on 6 Dec. 2015 // I was a bit sceptical about this - but it's been a real hit. My two girls  are sharing it ad enjoying it - and both playing with it.We've never had  one before, but the thing I didn't get from the product photos is that all the pieces build towards a scene: the front of the box folds down to make a skating tableau. Then, all the bits add to the play.I'd definitely think about one next year, at least for the younger one
column2: Great Advent calendar to keep children amused all December and beyond. // 5.0 // 29 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: SinginSuzy

on 29 Dec. 2015 // Initially thought this was expensive but daughter has had such fun opening the windows every day and now has a great selection of Lego bits and pieces - although I'm  having to be very VERY careful when vacuuming as some of the pieces are so tiny. Also glad I paid attention to the serial number as I could easily have bought the same one as last year by mistake.
column2: Very much loved Advent Calendar // 5.0 // 19 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: Miffy

on 19 Dec. 2015 // The 8 year old girl I bought this for loves it, and is really enjoying making the daily item.My only criticism is that each calendar door is very difficult to open as the stiff card is laminated, and the perforations are really hard to break. We have to help her with this, and even we as adults find it hard to open the doors.
column2: no Santa and only 2 mini-dolls again // 4.0 // 31 Oct. 2015 // By

column1: Su

TOP 100 REVIEWER on 31 Oct. 2015 // *** Please note - contains content spoilers ***The 41102 Friends 2015 Advent Calendar and as with most other advent calendars it has 24 windows to open, one on each day of December building up to Christmas.Interestingly I was looking through some old boxes and found some of the advent calendars from when I was a child and they had a ""special"" gift for Christmas Day, shame they don't do that with the Lego these days.This advent calendar consists of 233 pieces.1 - Andrea mini doll - dark haired, with blue and red seasonal jumper, grey tights, red skirt and boots2 - skates and seat3 - sledge4 - snowman - poor figure, single brick centre with a round ""shield"" does not make a snowman5 - Liza - blonde mini doll with white outfit.6 - skies, helmet, poles and a course flag7 - microphone and stand8 - speaker9 - saxophone and stand10 - 20 blue accessories - hair brushes, ribbons, etc11 - storage container, wand and tiara12 - white bunny and stand13 - wall arch and cake14 - oven and cake15 - cups and jugs16 - dressing table17 - 2 seats and a flame18 - table 19 - ice hockey sticks and stand20 - arch 21 - catapult22 - knock the cups down 23 - Christmas tree24 - penguin on a rock.You may have noticed that there is no Santa which is a Christmas disappointment.  There is one in the City build though.Read more ›",""

column8: I've heard some concerns as to its safety, is it safe? // What do you mean by safe?
column9: Does it come with a tray for the sand? // No, it doesn't. We use plastic bag, newspaper ,..its really mess free so you can use anything. Hope this helps.

on 8 April 2015 // Quick delivery. I bought this and the beach set as I've got two children and that way they both had enough sand and shapes to share without fighting! column1: Rebecca C

on 22 Nov. 2015 // Fantastic product - kids love it and it is slightly less messy than the real thing. The only real negative I found was that you need to find an enclosed 'playmat/surface' unless you want it getting everywhere and losing half of it. We ended up using a bucket lid. It is fascinating the way the sand 'moves' after you put it down after you have been moulding it in your hands. It is great for crafting and the kids loved the supplied shapes which were easily used with the sand. Would recommend.
column2: Best invention EVER! Great fun for kids  // 5.0 // 20 Nov. 2015 // By

column1: CrisG

on 20 Nov. 2015 // Bought as a gift after seeing it on display in a local toy shop that were out of stock. So clever! Play doh like feel to the sand, encouraging fine motor skills.The box comes with a few small sand toys and is perfect for little hands. Additional sand can be bought to build on this box.The gift was a hit! Perfect Christmas gift
column2: Great motion sand and seller // 5.0 // 31 Mar. 2016 // By

column1: Terry

on 31 Mar. 2016 // The children love this it is easy to use and clear up after they have played with it.Adults like it aswell fun to play with Highly recommen this motion sand.The price is cheaper than the shops.I have ordered more from this seller.Delivery was fast 5 days and that was over the easter weekend.Highly recommend seller and the sand
column2: Good fun for 4 year old // 4.0 // 26 Dec. 2015 // By

column1: bimple

on 26 Dec. 2015 // My daughter loves this. It is still quite messy if you use it indoors though, would suggest it as an outside toy in the summer months. Alternatively I put a plastic tablecloth under her little table to catch the bits that fall off, then shake it outside afterwards.",""

column1: Cheryl M-M

TOP 1000 REVIEWER on 3 Nov. 2011 // If you buy one thing for your child leading up to Christmas then I suggest you buy one of these. They are great fun, durable and well worth the money. Behind each door is a playmobil item, some of them larger others small, but they all belong to one set or subject. For instance the Dragon calendar has a  dragon and Knights with horses. The sets that emerge from the doors are actually much more expensive if you buy the items in a single playmobil packet.
column2: Good improvement on a great toy // 5.0 // 2 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: Jo Bennie

VINE VOICE on 2 Dec. 2010 // I've purchased a different one of these for my daughter over several years and in term of construction of the calender I really appreciate that it is already made up, rather than fiddling with construction on the night of 30th November previous years.  Only had 2 days so far but loving it.
column2: an excellent alternative to chocolate calendars // 4.0 // 19 Jan. 2012 // By

column1: fluffysalamander

on 19 Jan. 2012 // This is an excellent idea,it is the first time I have bought a non chocolate advent calender and I will be doing it again next year.My son was so excited when he saw this as he has a few of the Playmobil knight sets and really wanted a dragon to go with it. He enjoyed waiting to see what he would get each day-he would try and guess what he would get every night before he went to bed.I would have liked the calendars to be more Christmassy but most of the chocolate ones are not Christmas theamed either.These advent calendars are much more expensive than the chocolate ones but the toys have been played with daily since being opened so I can't really complain about it.
MrsClarky

on 3 Dec. 2011 // My boys loved this, although a little pricey for an advent calender they love the fact that they are adding every day to their playset and it means they have the complete play set on Christmas Eve to play with before the big man arrives.
column2: Perfect for Big and Little Kids! // 5.0 // 6 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: Emily Taylor

on 6 Dec. 2010 // I bought this for my boyfriend as a joke present for Christmas, and we're having so much fun with it! Great value for money, and perfect for harking back to the days of your childhood.
column2: The excitement keeps on building.. // 5.0 // 21 Dec. 2010 // By

column1: Andrew MCINTOSH

on 21 Dec. 2010 // This Advent calendar has been a massive success.Our 3 and half year old son has been keen on Playmobile for the last 6 to 8 months so this was going to be a natural choice for the budding soldier/buzz lightyear/policeman fan. After the first few days of opening the doors and building up the knights collection of armour and weapons, we let our him see what was still to come by talking through the pictures on the back of the covering box.Our son has had a great time playing with the card 'castle' that comes with the calendar and I have been able to explain to him the educational side of what helmets were for and why the horses wear protective clothing.The highlight of the month has been the red, fire breathing dragon !! I wish that I had one of those when I was a child..While some days are a little less inspiring , the bigger toys make it all worthwhile. As we know, Playmobile characters are built to last so no amount of jousting or sword play will damage them.For the price, an educational and for once non chocolate based calendar! Great buy and worth seeing the smiles each day a new door is opened.
column2: Best advent calendar ever // 5.0 // 23 Dec. 2011 // By

column1: Granni

on 23 Dec. 2011 // Wasnt sure if this was an over indulgence on my part at 1st but couldnt resist buying this for my Grandson. But he has totally loved it and has played with it though the whole of december.  He wasnt allowed to open a window till he found the number and he has created many stories around the characters. He is 3 yrs and i will buy one next yr too.
celvin

on 21 Dec. 2011 // My son has had so much enjoyment out of this toy.  The 'set' and characters have provided him with hours of imaginary play and he was overly excited by the 20th December when he got the dragon.  Highly recommend this on the run up to Christmas.",""

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Kinetic-Sand-6024397-Box-Set/dp/B00M2L6BPI","Colour Name:Shimmering Sapphire Now in shimmering Blue Sapphire! Kinetic Sand is the squeezable you mold with your hands! Youve seen it before, but youve never felt anything like it! Pack it, pull it, shape it and love it, Kinetic Sand is so incredible you cant put it down. Its kinetic - meaning it sticks to itself and not to you! It oozes, moves and melts right before your eyes. It flows through your fingers like a slow-moving liquid, but leaves them completely dry. Kinetic Sand stimulates childrens creative skills allowing them to create anything they can imagine over and over again. With 1 pound of Blue Sapphire sand the creative possibilities are endless! column1: Thomas Douglas

TOP 500 REVIEWERVINE VOICE on 9 Oct. 2014 // New for 2014, the Lego Friends advent calendar is an excellent set, with 24 mini models to create.The are two minifigures included - Mia and Ewa - along with festive regulars such as a Christmas tree, sled, deer and fireplace, plus a Christmas dinner theme, with food, plates, glasses, a cooker and some decorations.A nice build up to Christmas, which model that can then be used all year round.As usual with the Lego advent calendars, the models are fiddly to make, and smaller children will need some hel.The other new advent calendars this year are Lego Star Wars and Lego City, and if you have a household full of Lego fans, you will probably do what I did and buy all three!There are lots of deals to be had on these advent calendars, and it pays to shop around.
column2: Expensive but very enjoyable // 4.0 // 19 Dec. 2014 // By

column1: Miss Charlotte E L George

on 19 Dec. 2014 // I have to say that I was very dubious about spending what is quite frankly a lot of money on small amounts of lego . That said I consoled myself with the thought in my mind that this would be something I would count as an early Christmas present. It has been really nice to see my daughter opening this each morning rather than the usual chocolate version and she has enjoyed putting bits together and seeing her collection build. It is nice that they have some super simple bits to put together as well as a few bits that are moderately more challenging. I think in all a success and I may well be buying another next year!
column2: and i have recommended to friends too // 5.0 // 8 Jan. 2015 // By

Simply great!

fa5a448d33c80215988abeb0860ac3c5,"Djeco Coloured Sands Birds of Paradise [Toy]","Djeco","23.31","3 new","3","1","4.7 out of 5 stars","Arts & Crafts > Children's Craft Kits","http://www.amazon.co.uk/More-Time-Pieces-Cello-Volume/dp/184849162X
column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/LEGO-60092-City-Explorers-Submarine/dp/B00SDTZ09G","Djeco Birds Of Paradise Colored Sand Kit -- 18 pc.Each activity piece is about 8.25"" x 5.9"". The kit includes 12 colors of sand in individual containers, stickers to mark the sand containers, a pealing tool, 4 activity pieces and an instruction booklet. The theme is colorful birds. The variety of colors make the activity pieces really colorful and beautiful. Bright colors with earth tones give them a nice balance of colors. The kits are designed to be done in their boxes. Each box has a small hole in a corner for excess sand to be funneled back into the containers. The process is easy to do to get consistently good results. Place the desired activity piece in the box. Use the pealing tool to peal off the first location for the sand. Take the colored sand for that location and gently tap enough to cover the location on the activity piece. Tilt and tap the box to move excess sand to the bottom of the box. Position the sand container for that color near the hole and tap the sand to the hole and into the container.Product Dimensions : 6.5  x 9  x 1.5 Age: 6 to 12 years.","Technical Details Item Weight517 g Product Dimensions22.9 x 16.5 cm Manufacturer recommended age:6 - 12 years Item model numberDJ08639 Number of Puzzle Pieces18 Assembly RequiredNo Batteries Required?No Batteries Included?No    Additional Information ASINB003VEU11A Best Sellers Rank 94,549 in Toys & Games  #149 in Toys & Games > Arts & Crafts > Art Sand #4675 in Toys & Games > Arts & Crafts > Children's Craft Kits Shipping Weight558 g Delivery Destinations:Visit the Delivery Destinations Help page to see where this item can be delivered. Date First Available3 Aug. 2010    Feedback  Would you like to update product info or give feedback on images?","Djeco Birds Of Paradise Colored Sand Kit -- 18 pc.Each activity piece is about 8.25"" x 5.9"". The kit includes 12 colors of sand in individual containers, stickers to mark the sand containers, a pealing tool, 4 activity pieces and an instruction booklet. The theme is colorful birds. The variety of colors make the activity pieces really colorful and beautiful. Bright colors with earth tones give them a nice balance of colors. The kits are designed to be done in their boxes. Each box has a small hole in a corner for excess sand to be funneled back into the containers. The process is easy to do to get consistently good results. Place the desired activity piece in the box. Use the pealing tool to peal off the first location for the sand. Take the colored sand for that location and gently tap enough to cover the location on the activity piece. Tilt and tap the box to move excess sand to the bottom of the box. Position the sand container for that color near the hole and tap the sand to the hole and into the container.Product Dimensions : 6.5  x 9  x 1.5 Age: 6 to 12 years.","","","Djeco's Bird's of Paradise // 5.0 // 14 Nov. 2012 // By

column6: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Moshi-Monsters-Micro-Theme-Playset/dp/B00A21L1GE","Product Description Welcome to Moshi Monsters. A virtual world of monstrous proportions where kids can adopt their own pet monster. Monstro City provides and exciting platform for users to make friends, explore the world, solve puzzles and of course look after your new pet.Moshling are little creatures that live in the wilds of the Moshi Monsters world. Players can capture them by planting seeds in their garden. If they get the correct combination of seeds to bloom a Moshling will be attracted to their garden.How to create your Moshi. Adopt one of the six monsters, customize its colour scheme and then name it. Nurture it so that it is happy and healthy.Have fun with your Moshi. Play a daily puzzle to earn Rox  and go shopping with the Rox you have earned. Communicate with your friends via their pin boards. Customise your monster and style its room.Countdown to a MICRO Moshi Twistmas! 24 doors with a surprise MICRO moshling behind each. Includes 24 gifts with 7 exclusive Christmas style MICRO moshlings and some special Twistmas codes. For ages 4 years up. Players can capture them by planting seeds in their garden. If they get the correct combination of seeds to bloom a Moshling will be attracted to their garden.How to create your Moshi. Adopt one of the six monsters, customize its colour scheme and then name it. Nurture it so that it is happy and healthy.Have fun with your Moshi. Play a daily puzzle to earn Rox  and go shopping with the Rox you have earned. Communicate with your friends via their pin boards. Customise your monster and style its room.Countdown to a MICRO Moshi Twistmas! 24 doors with a surprise MICRO moshling behind each. Includes 24 gifts with 7 exclusive Christmas style MICRO moshlings and some special Twistmas codes. For ages 4 years up. Box Contains 24 x Micro Moshis","","","Micro Moshi Advent // 5.0 // 12 Nov. 2013 // By

column1: NikkiS

on 12 Nov. 2013 // I bought last year's Moshi Monster advent calendar, so when I told my 9 year old there was a Micro Moshi one this year she smiled very sweetly at me!!!!It is clearly marked this year where to open it to reveal the advent doors, but saying that I didn't think last year's one was that hard to work out.I have a very excited daughter who can't wait for 1st December to come.I think it is great value at £10 for 24 Micro Moshis, I originally saw it priced at £16 so snapped it up when it was reduced to £10.Delivery as usual great.If you have a Moshi fan then I would highly recommend it.
column2: Twistmas comes but once a year // 5.0 // 29 Sept. 2013 // By

column1: A to Z

TOP 500 REVIEWERVINE VOICE on 29 Sept. 2013 // We enjoyed Moshi Monsters Moshi Advent Calendar last year and so I purchased the micro version for this year.  I've had a bit of a sneaky look inside and know the kids are going to love it.As befits their micro status, the micro advent calendar is a bit more compact  and like its larger brother the front folds down to reveal 24 doors each with a special edition micro-moshling and code for an item on the online site behind them.I assume the manufacturers have taken on board some of the comments about last year's calendar, there's a big labelled sticker to remove so you can open the front to avoid confusion and the micro moshlings are better secured in the casing so they are not going to fall out of their compartment, and also you can get an idea of what you are going to get on the back.  It's stands up fine.Inside, the 24 micro moshlings are the same size as the collectable ones and similar quality.  Most of them are in shades of festive red and green , and the special Christmas ones feature micro moshlings such as Iggy as a Christmas tree and Peppy with a Christmas bell on his head - if your kids are into Moshi they'll know what this means.  My pack doesn't contain exactly what is on the photo so there's still some surprise potential, I think I will be hiding the picture on the back from the kids though somehow.Overall, given that you get 24 figures  this is fair value, and I think more exciting than the chocolate calendars.  I would recommend it for die hard Moshi fans, though if you haven't had one before the one with the larger Moshlings in is possibly a slightly better buy, even more plastic for your money.
Mark72

on 15 Nov. 2013 // My Daughter loves Moshi Monsters and I have recently been buying her the micro moshi monster sets for £4.99 which inclde about 8.  So for a tenner you can't go wrong for a Xmas calender, a child that loves Moshis and 24 figures to collect.

on 30 Dec. 2013 // My daughter loved this- we struggled to find a gluten-free chocolate calendar for her this year so I opted for this instead. She was very happy with it as she got a micro moshi figure  and a code to use online everyday.Because the calendar was almost half the r.r.p online it meant that it was an economical way for my daughter to boost her collection of Micro moshis and it was something she was genuinely excited about opening.

on 6 Dec. 2013 // Know my daughter loves moshi m ..This calander is very colourful sturdy and yesterday day 5 the monster was a gold crocodile dressed like a fairy with a halo ....even me mum went ahhhhhhh and smiled ..the other monsters have been red or green ....smaller than the Normal monsters you buy but this adds to the appeal .So happy with my purchase and my daughter opens this one over her chocolate one ......that says everything .

column1: stunnerv

on 29 Nov. 2015 // Awful stuff; doesn't stick together but it does stick to clothes. And the only way to get it back out of the carpet is to vacuum it up... which defeats the purpose We live in quite a small apartment so before buying this living sand we checked it out quite thoroughly on the internet first  e.g, we watched a comparison on YouTube called ""6 Sand Comparison!"" it's about 1/2 hour long, plus a ""Sands Alive Starter Kit Opening & Review"" and both of them show Sands Alive product with very different properties . Anyway, we needed a sand that would clump together for indoor use and opted for the Sands Alive brand as it gave the broadest appeal.Sadly, the 'sand' in the package acts nothing like the sand in any of the videos, it's not dried out but it virtually acts as if it is; unlike being dough-like it acts as if it's the raw ingredients for making dough and yes, it makes just as much mess. In fact it's worse, as at least flour comes out of clothes simply by dusting off, but this Sands Alive stuff only comes out by being put through the washing machine.It was still fun for our 4-year old to play with but then again, cleaning is not one of his duties yet.The batch codes on the bag with sand are: 15010596 + 15010736The only positive I can say about this experience is that the retailer, Fun Filled Toys UK, was excellent; very helpful and provided a swift refund.
Miss Hajar De-Chausay

on 22 Dec. 2015 // Nothing to store the sand in and the models don't really retain their structure. The sand doesn't stain clothes but doesn't just brush off either. Overall not great considering the price... play-doh is more versatile.

column2: Not as I expected. // 2.0 // 24 Mar. 2016 // By

column1: Amazon Customer

on 24 Mar. 2016 // Because the sand doesn't stain and is non-toxic, it is perfect for being able to play with indoors during the winter when you can't get to the beach to make proper sandcastles!I did find it relatively mess free and, any mess that was made could be swept up easily though I will only let my children play with it in the dining room where there is no carpet.I liked that the set had a good sized tray included to play with the sand.  There was plenty of space in the trays to make plenty of sculptures and still left plenty of space for them to play with the sand.  I would have liked to have seen lids for the trays to be able to store the sand easier.The quality of the plastic modelling tools provided is great.  The plastic is strong and will stand up to a lot of play.Although Sands Alive claims to look and feel like real sand I don't really agree.  It definitely feels more like a modelling sand than real sand which is not a bad thing.  It does, however, look more like sand than other sets we have had in the past as it is sand coloured.My 7 year old son found the sand very easy to model both with his hands and with the moulds provided.  My 3 year old daughter struggled a little, though still had fun playing with the sand.The sand came out of the moulds very easily and I was really impressed with how much detail was imprinted onto the sand.Once my son had made the sculptures they did stay standing until he knocked them down to pack the sand away.  The sand does stick together very well.For the price, I think the set is excellent value for money.  You receive plenty of sand and a lot of moulds to play with.Read more ›

column9: http://www.amazon.co.uk/Kinetic-Sand-1-5-Neon-Playset-Purple/dp/B0123WB32G","","Kinetic sand itself is clean and odour-free but strangely addictive // 5.0 // 23 Nov. 2015 // By

column1: Tim Uddin

on 23 Nov. 2015 // Kinetic sand is a good 'novelty' product for toddler who are perhaps more accustomed to more usual toys.We got this kinetic sand box set after seeing some in a shop on holiday, And we found that it's much cheaper online!  The kinetic sand feel great, which is quite soft. It's strangely addictive but the fact that it sticks to itself means its not too messy to have on a desk or coffee table and spillages can be cleaned up quite easily with more sand.Kinetic sand itself is clean and odour-free. The sand has no distinct smell and it doesn't leave any sticky residue on your hands. It doesn't stick to carpets or solid surfaces or anything. If you do get any on the carpet you can just vacuum it up.This product to be a good novelty toy for children. It is 'different' and it is guaranteed to get their attention and hold their interest for a while. It encourages early creativity and fires their imagination.
column2: Moulds so easy allowing you to see the features of the moulds // 5.0 // 22 Jan. 2016 // By

on 22 Jan. 2016 // Well where do it start. This sand is has the most unusual feel to it. You expect it to be wet when it's dry to touch. Moulds so easy allowing you to see the features of the moulds. It doesn't leave sand particle all over the place as normal sand does. Better than play dough. I find it a bit expensive but considering the ease of using this it is well worth the money. Would be nice if we could buy multi colours as a package instead of a one colour purchase.

column1: Petersgirl

on 21 Oct. 2013 // I bought this as a gift for my husband, who loves tawny owls. It is made of wood  with blocks that contain the months of the year and numbers. It is quite dinky  and looks lovely on a shelf. It is also well made and doesn't look cheap or rough.The owl is also a delight as it isn't a generic 'brown owl' and actually has some features of the tawny.I have used it every day since purchase and find it helps me remember the date much better than before because I have to constantly change it. It would also be a good educational toy for children who struggle to remember days or months.The great thing about it is that it will never expire or be superfluous. Overall, a lovely product with unlimited use for a good price. Magnificent!

column1: SJSmith

on 30 Dec. 2012 // We bought this for our 3 1/2 year old son and he loved every day opening up the window and getting a toy to add to the scene.  As he had a chocolate advent calendar that we used appropriately for days he  made the decision to just enjoy this and not open it up in date order.  Each day contained a toy ranging from a traffic cone that could be used at an accident through to figures and bikes.  For most of December he used the ready made scene that came with it and then the figures began to join in with his others in alternative activities and the scene went by the wayside.  Either way it was great value for money . I've given it 4/5 stars for educational value as it can be educational if that's how you make it; for durability I've given it 5 stars for the figures alone but the scene itself isn't durable.  We'll definitely be on the look out for this for 2013.

on 5 Dec. 2010 // Bought this for my daughters for Christmas.  They love it, & it provides hours of fun each day - extra morning excitment as a new addition to the set arrives.  Only watch out - previous Playmobile Advent Calendars are reusable, as they come with individual boxes that are attached to a cardboard screen each day.  This version is a more traditional Advent Calendar design - a box with indivdual doors for each day, & so can't be easily reused next year.
